loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 62 years old, a married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Mariam is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do maintenance for her home, specially the kitchen. Mariam is hoping to start a home-based project to increase her family income.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home, especially the kitchen.

loans.name: Amivi Mawuena

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée un Géomètre de profession. Elle a 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier 03 mois.
Amivi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale genres sucres, savons, laits et autres à toutes personnes à son domicile. 
Amivi a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre des produit d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amivi voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is a 34-year-old woman. She is married to a land surveyor. She has 3 children, two of whom attend school. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 3 months old.

Amivi has been selling things since 2006. She buys and resells general food products, such as sugar, soap, milk, and other things to people at her house. 

Amivi requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and sell general food products. She wants to reinvest her supplementary earnings back into her business.

In the coming years, Amivi would like to open a boutique. She says that with her earnings, she plans to contribute to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food items

loans.name: Ngugi

texts.en: Ngugi is 52 years old and married with five children.  He has been farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 20 years and has employed two people.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and his living standards. He hopes to venture into dairy farming in five years.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Simbumba Mission A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simbumba Mission A Group in Western Kenya! Bomet is the facilitator of the Simbumba Mission A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bomet takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bomet had a very good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bomet was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bomet and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Bomet will invest in livestock rearing and buy an additional plot of land.

In 2012, the members of Simbumba Mission A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Bomet is pictured in the group with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Lino is 55 years of age, married, and has been blessed with three children. He is glad that he is able to provide for the needs of his family. Lino has been engaged in a corn farming business for five years. According to him, he is able to earn about P35,000 per cropping season. His income goes to their daily needs, allowances of children, payment for electric bills and some amount was used in maintaining their corn field. 

Lino would like to ask for additional capital amounting to P27,000 allowing him to buy his farm supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and certified seeds for his farming business. He believes that through his patience and effort in improving his corn field he could be able to improve their way of living. In addition, his income will also increase. In this way, he could sustain his family needs. He hopes that he could get the loan amount he requested.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as insecticides, certified seeds and fertilizer for his corn farming business.

loans.name: Kamket S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kamket S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of Kamket S.H.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season,Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Joseph was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kamket S.H.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 48 years old and has six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling onions in Yei, South Sudan, for nine years. She is a widow. Jane requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase onions for resale.

loans.name: Sohun

texts.en:
Sohun is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her oldest son is 7 years old and he is in school, while her 4-year-old daughter is not in school yet. 

Sohun is a farmer. She started farming on her rice field nearly 5 years ago. She has also been making a living with planting sugarcane and she worked for others at a sugarcane plantation to generate additional income. 

She has been with VisionFund for 3 years. Sohun is requesting a third loan to cultivate her rice paddy and plant sugarcane. She hopes this loan will help her increase her crop yield and that the sugarcane trees will provide more income to feed her family, build some savings for the future and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice paddy and plant sugarcane trees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie is 57 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 31. She takes care of two children. Euphrasie owns a business selling various goods, such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt, cosmetics, soap, biscuits, etc. This is her 13th successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 8.30 pm every day. She currently employs 2 people to help her.

Euphrasie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods for the business, such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt, cosmetics, soap, biscuits, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cosmetics, bread, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Sisimukha S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Sisimukha SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Banana B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Banana B Group in Western Kenya! Gelan is the facilitator of Banana B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gelan takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season,Gelan had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Gelan was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gelan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Gelan will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Banana B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 30 years old and a married woman who has six children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for seven years. Lona requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Philgone

texts.en: Philgone is 37 years old, married, and blessed with five children.  She runs a pharmacy so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years.  She has employed one person in the business.  She also relies on her husband for financial support. Her desire is to expand her business in five years.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 31 years of age and married to a farmer. They have been blessed with three children. The couple do their best to support their family. Her husband is a farmer and at the same time an operator of his motorcycle transport business. Janette is glad that she and her husband work together to sustain the needs of her family. 

Janette has run her corn farming business for three years, and she is able to earn about P5,000 per cropping season. Aside from the farming business, she is also a teacher within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. Janette would like to maintain her corn field and provide all the important farm supplies to make it more productive, but due to the high cost of farm supplies, she is in need of additional capital amounting to P27,000. This amount could be a big help in maintaining and improving her corn field. She hopes that she could obtain her loan request. She would be glad if she could increase her crop production this next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides and to pay the labor costs of planting certified seeds.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband, both of her children have moved out. She is a cook and has been working as a cook in some public organizations since 1986. 

Since she married and moved to the new apartment with her family, she has still been using their initial furniture which was made in Russia. The furniture has became very old and is damaged now. Therefore she decided to buy new Korean and Western furniture for her home. It needed over MNT 2,500,000 to purchase. The loan she is taking out will be used to purchase the new furniture to do renovations at her home.

loans.use: To purchase the some new furniture to do renovations at her home.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambaa, 54, is responsible for a public toilet  in a bazaar called “Da-Khuree”. She has been running her business since 2007 and owns 3 toilets in other places within the bazaar. She lives with her son and husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her home furniture has been used for many years and she still has not been able to replace it with new furniture. All of it has became old and damaged. Therefore she decided to buy new Korea and Western furniture for her home. She needed over MNT 2,200,000 to purchase it. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the new furniture for her home.

loans.use: To purchase some new furniture for her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old, married and has two children.  She sells clothes so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for four years.  She also runs a salon for extra income.  She was previously employed before she went into business.

Mary has really benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped her to improve her business.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in  the future.  She needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea is a widow and has four children. She is 41 years old and has been planting crops with her parents since she was around 10 years old. Now she plants crops on her own. This is the first loan that Thea is requesting from VisionFund. Thea took the loan to plant crops on her farmland. She hopes that the crops will grow well and can make more income to feed her children and she can set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: To plant crops.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 31 years old and is married with two children, ages 2 and 5. Claude owns a business selling rice, sugar, beans, sorghum and potatoes.

He has six years in this business. His hours of work are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more rice, sugar, beans, sorghum and potatoes to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save in his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, beans, sorghum and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Zolbayar

texts.en: Mr. Zolbayar is 28 years old and works as a technician in the power plant of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a technician for six years. He is a young father and lives with his family in a house located in the industrial district of Ulaanbaatar. Mr. Zolbayar and his family have been living in this house since he was a child. Lately his house has became very old and much of it is damaged. Therefore he is planning to make some repairs and renovate his house by himself before this winter. He needs MNT 600,000 to purchase the building materials according to his calculations. The loan Zolbayar is taking will be used to purchase the necessary building materials to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Amula

texts.en: Amula is 29 years old. She is a married woman who has four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling beans and fish in Yei, South Sudan, for four years. Amula requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and fish to sell. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and dry fish to sell.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mr. Otgonbayar, age 47, is a radioman in a military unit of the Mongolian armed forces. He owns land and wooden houses in the outer city of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He rents his houses to the families who move into the city and want to pay cheaper-than-market rent costs. It is an additional business of his income source. Currently there are eight households on his land and every month they pay him rental payments. Lately, his houses have been become old and damaged in some parts. Therefore he is planning to renovate them before this winter. This will be beneficial to his business future and will provide more comfortable living conditions for his customers. He needs the loan to purchase building materials to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Otgonjav

texts.en: Mrs. Otgonjav is 45 years old. She is a widow and she works as a teacher in a kindergarten in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has two sons and currently lives with her younger son. Her salary is generally not enough for her family expenses. Her younger son, Lkhagva-Ochir, has no job and wants to support his mother by earning an income. Thus, he has decided to start a taxi business. The loan Otgonjav is taking will be dedicated to covering the cost of buying a new car so her son can start a taxi business.

loans.use: to buy a new car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 46 years old and is married with six children. She owns a business selling food and soft drinks like Fanta, water and juice in her restaurant.

She has been in this business for four years and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 9 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant business by buying more food and drinks such as Fanta, water and juice to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant by buying more food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 40 is a hairdresser. She has been doing her business for six years and already has her own permanent customers. She is divorced and now lives with her daughter, a university student, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Oyuncimeg wants to renovate her work tools, clippers, and other equipment for her barbershop because they have become old and have some damage to them lately. 

Therefore, Oyunchimeg is taking out a loan to purchase the new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.use: To purchase new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is working hard to meet the needs of her family. She is 33 years old and married, having only one child. Her husband is her helper in improving their corn fields to be more productive. Mary Ann has been managing her corn field for almost 18 years. From the long period of time she has spent working in her corn field, she noticed that the price of farm supplies is increasing, so her funds are no longer enough to purchase farm supplies. Mary Ann decided to join the program of a lending institution where she could borrow additional capital to provide the supplies for her corn field.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan of P27,000 to be used in buying farm supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, certified seeds and for labor costs for planting and plowing the corn field. She is hoping that her request loan will be granted to make her corn field more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, certified seeds, pesticides and pay labor costs for planting and plowing the corn field.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 30 years old, a married woman with seven children. Five of them are in school. She has had a business selling bananas and avocados in Yei, South Sudan for six years.

Salome requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bananas and avocados. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and avacados for sale.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Recently, Gantulga has bought a small-sized plot of land in a suburban district. He still could not finish making the payment due to insufficient funds. According his plan, next year he will start his dream house building.
 
The loan he is taking out will be used to cover the payment for his new land for family needs.

loans.use: To cover the payment for new land for family needs.

loans.name: Kopiya Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Kopiya Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Leonard as its facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Leonard is the father of one child. He joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and in order to grow enough to feed his family. In the recent 2011 season, Leonard had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Leonard was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leonard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Leonard will invest in livestock rearing and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Kopiya group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Leonard is pictured with his group members in the photograph and with their Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is a 45-year-old father of five children, three of whom are daughters. His children are still in school. For the last 23 years, he has been farming with his wife on his rice field to earn a living. He also fishes and builds houses to generate additional income. He completely paid his first loan to VisionFund. Now he is applying for his second loan in order to grow more rice. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his crop yield to earn more income to feed his family, increase his savings and expand his business as well as keep his children in school.

loans.use: to grow more rice.

loans.name: Ukulima Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ukulima Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne being their facilitator, Ukulima group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne is a mother of one child. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will save for future use and buy sheet iron for her house.

In 2012, the members of Ukulima group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Everlyne is pictured with her group members in the photograph, with their Field Officer on the far left in the white shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Unisa. He is married to a trader and has four children ages 10, 7, 5 and 2. Three of them are school-going children. In 2006, Unisa established his bread business. He began his business because when his father died, he did not have a sponsor to see him through higher education, so he started doing petty trading. 

In 1994, he joined his landlord who owns a bakery for baking bread. Gradually he improved until 2006, when he started his own business. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to purchase flour, sugar and yeast.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL.

In the future, Unisa plans to build a house and get a modern bakery. This business helps him a lot as he is able to solve his domestic problems and improve his business. Unisa wants his children to have a good education. The rise in the cost of materials - including flour and sugar and manual labor - are his major business challenges. 

He serves retailers and consumers in the outskirts and in the city center. He has four laborers who do the mixing of the flour. He buys his raw materials in Makeni and sometimes in Freetown. He usually buys his materials twice a month through his supplier's delivery van. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and yeast for his bakery.

loans.name: Melek

texts.en:
Melek has been doing her work for eight years. Since she started, she has increased her customer base and expanded her sales. 

Melek finished primary school, married at age 17 and had her first of three children at age 18. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 4. After she finished primary school, while she sat at home taking care of her children, she thought she had the capacity to work from home. She asked her sister to teach her how to customize towels, tablecloths, runners, etc. At first, she made them for herself.  Those around her liked her designs and started to give her orders. She also receives orders from Turks in Germany for customized presents.

This is her second loan form Maya. She will use this loan to buy her materials in bulk for a better price and bring some different designs to the market as well as expand her products so she can sell them from other shops. 

Through her work, she wants to improve her family’s income and to enable her children to have a better future.

In the future, Melek wants to open her own workshop, bringing other women like herself together in order to earn money.

She is self-confident, decisive and determined.

Note: Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Melek Hanım,bu işi sekiz yıldır yapıyor.  Bu işe başladığından bu yana müşteri potansiyelini ve satışlarını arttırdı.

Melek ilkokulu bitirdi,17 yaşında evlendi ve 18 yaşında ilk çocuğunu dünyaya getirdi.  En büyüğü 10 ve en küçüğü 4 yaşında.  İlkokuldan mezun olduktan sonra,evde çocuklarına bakarken,kendinde yetenek olduğunu düşündü ve ablasına çeyiz işlerini öğretmesini söyledi.  İlk once kendisi için yaptı.  Etrafındakiler yaptığı işleri beğendi and sipariş almaya başladı.  Üstelik siparişlerini Almanya’daki Türkler’den alıyor.

Bu Maya’dan aldığı ikinci kredi.  Bu kredi ile daha iyi fiyattan malzeme alıcak,pazarlardan farklı tasarımlar getirtecek ve diğer esnaflara ürünlerini satmayı planlıyor.

İşi ile ailesinin gelirini arttırmayı düşünüyor ve çocukları için daha iyi bir gelecek istiyor.

Gelecekte kendi işini açıp diğer kadınlara da iş sağlayıp para kazanmalarını istiyor.

Melek Hanım,kendine güvenen,azimli ve kararlı.

loans.use: to buy her materials in bulk for a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Saio

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Saio. He is married to a businesswoman and has one child who is 5 months old. Saio established his business in 2005. He began his business because he was assisting his elder brother in doing business. His brother gave him some money to establish his own provision shop. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business.  

Saio would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Saio requires a loan in order to purchase batteries and Maggi noodles as well as to pay laborers.   He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. 

In the future, Saio plans to open a bigger shop with different items. He also plans to improve his family's standard of living and to help his child have a brighter future. This loan will help him to expand his business. He serves about 15 customers each day. He is hardworking and dedicated to his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase batteries and Maggi noodles as well as to pay laborers.

loans.name: Kochkonbek

texts.ru:
Кочконбеку 54 года. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Всю свою жизнь Кочконбек работал в сфере сельского хозяйства, сначала водителем в колхозе, затем разнорабочим. В 1996 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей  семьи, Кочконбек  организовал  собственное хозяйство и начал заниматься разведением скота и полеводством, стартовав с суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS).На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Кочконбека насчитывается  одна корова, 10 баранов, одна лошадь, а также – яблоневый сад, в культивирование которого Кочконбек вкладывает всю свою душу.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кочконбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов и саженцев новых сортов яблок. 
В будущем, Кочконбек планирует расширять поголовье скота и увеличить площадь яблоневого сада.
texts.en: Kochkonbek is 54 years old, married and has two children.  Kochkonbek spent all his life working in the agricultural field, first starting as a driver at a collective farm and then as a handyman.  In search of an additional source of income for his family, he organized his own farm in 1996 with a starting capital of 5,000 som (KGS) and started to breed livestock and farm land.  Today, Kochkonbek's farm contains one cow, ten sheep, one horse and also an apple orchard, into cultivating which he invests his whole soul.  In order to further develop his business, Kochkonbek requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep and seedlings of new apple varieties.  In the future, he plans to increase his livestock headcount and expand his apple orchard.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and seedlings of new apple varieties

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Sulaiman.  He is married to a small-scale trader who earns Le500,000 every month and has four children aged 18, 14, 10 and 3 years. Three are school-going children.  Sulaiman has two additional dependents, who live with him because they were brought by his spouse in order to assist them in their schooling. 

 In 2006, Sulaiman established his used clothing business.  He began his business to help him get a source of income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Sulaiman has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to purchase baseball shirts - 1 bale @ Le3,200,000 and skirts - 1 bale @ Le1,600,000 while the balance of Le200,000 will be used for transportation.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.

 In the future, Sulaiman plans to have his own houses and to educate his children to university level.  This loan will help him to improve his business.  He serves about 40 customers around town.  His business is popular because he sells  quality used clothing; he has good interpersonal relationships with his customers.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase baseball shirts and skirts and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mamusu.  She is married to a farmer and has four children aged 20, 18, 15 and 13 years. In 1991, Mamusu established her household utensils business. She began her business because she realised she needed to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Mamusu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following: plastic drums - 6 pieces @ Le720,000, fish pan sets - 6 sets @ Le1, 200,000, big size dish pans - 12 sets @ Le960,000; medium-sized dish pans - 20 sets @ Le600, 000, small-sized dish pan - 30 sets @ Le600,000 and bowl pans - 12 dozen @ Le900,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, Mamusu plans to help her children acquire university education and to build her own shop. She is different from her competitors because of different items with good quality. She serves about 12 customers each day, her business is popular because she has good interpersonal relationships with her customers. She is an honest and hard-working business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase household utensils for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Abed Al-Kareem

texts.en:
Abed Al-Kareem is a 37-year-old man. He is married with no children. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Abed Al-Kareem wants to make some repairs to his house such as painting and changing tiles, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Abed Al-Kareem gets the loan, he will be able to pay for making repairs for his house and this will provide the family better and more healthful living conditions. Abed Al-Kareem is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay the expenses for making some repairs to his house.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 44-year-old man. He is married and has one son and three daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Sami wants to purchase new home furniture to improve his family's living conditions. He wants to buy bedroom furniture for the children, dining room furniture, living room seats, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Sami gets the loan, he will be able to change his family's life positively by purchasing new home furniture. Sami is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu, 36, is a smart entrepreneur. She is involved in buying and selling sweets, beverages, cookies and other food at a prestigious city market. She is a very active young woman. She likes providing good service to her customers and is satisfied by it. She sells a wide variety of candy and cookies and her monthly income from selling is 120 AZN. She has about six years of experience in this field. 

Arzu is married and has two sons. Her husband helps her in running the business. 

Now she has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in case to purchase more goods and increase her profit.

loans.use: purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to modernize his store and purchase a diverse assortment of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 40-year-old man. He is married and has four daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Mahmoud wants to complete his house by installing tiles, painting, installing doors and windows, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Mahmoud gets the loan, he will be able to pay the expenses for finishing his house. This will enable him to provide better and more comfortable living conditions to his family. 

Mahmoud is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for finishing his house.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is an active 49-year-old mother of three. Sevda is engaged in a farming business and cultivates wheat, seasonal fruits and vegetables. She sells her crops in the Agsu central bazaar. Her two sons and daughter always help her to improve their living conditions. The income she earns from this business allows her to take care of her family. 

She has a good credit history. Sevda needs to buy seeds and organic fertilizer. Sevda is requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN to help her with this purchase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is married with two children. He sells food items. His grocery store is located in a very busy place, Agsu central bazaar, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. Elshad has been running this business for four years. Step by step he was able to expand his small venture. 

Elshad’s business is the only source of income for his family and it is 300 AZN per month. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet the needs of his family. 

Today he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more foods to cover customers demand. Elshad is hoping that from the profit of his business, he can expand his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to protect his crops.

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Babek, 37, is married and has three children. 

Three years ago he decided to cultivate the land he owned. He did so to generate more income so he could support his family. 

Babek grows wheat, corn, seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he carefully tends so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. 

He will use the loan of 1,000 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer that will enable him to improve his yield. Babek enjoys doing this job and that's why he will continue to use loans so he can improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more fruit to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural is a 21-year-old dentist who just graduated from university and has a diploma in dentistry.  He is single and has two years of practice in this field. He opened his dentistry office a year ago and already can generate income from it, about 250 AZN per month. He has a lot of clients because he is very accurate and friendly towards his clients. Now he has applied for 600 AZN to purchase newer tools and improve the quality of his work. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase newer tools and improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is aged 27 and has been in farming for seven years in her home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya.She is married with one child aged five and produces maize, potatoes, beans and wheat for her local market.

Caroline has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank for irrigation purposes as well as to supply water for her dairy farm. She says their production for produce like beans is frequently hampered by inconsistent rainfalls and the irrigation system would help in alleviating the problem. She says the income will help her educate her child in future and improve the living standards of her entire family.

Caroline sees high costs of inputs like pesticides as the main challenges.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 43-year-old woman who is married with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary.

Heyam wants to change her old home furniture and purchase new items such as: living room seats, dinning room furniture, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Heyam gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and improve her family's living conditions. Heyam is a conservative woman, so her husband Adel is photographed instead in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where she lives with her family of four children, three of whom are in school, with the first born being an adult. She also works as a tailor to supplement her farming income. Her farm produces milk, vegetables, maize, and beans for the local market under her cereals retail business. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a posho-mill (a grains processing machine used to grind maize and other cereals) to start a grinding business in the local market. She says this will add value to her maize and beans retail business since she will now be selling part of her maize as flour and getting a better income. She adds she will use the income to educate her children and provide other basic needs for the family. This is Margaret's fourth loan request from Juhudi Kilimo with her previous loan being promptly repaid. 

She laments large price fluctuations as the major challenge with farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase a grain grinding machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He opened his own barbershop in 2003. His wife works as a female hairdresser and they both cooperate together to cover the family expenses--especially their children's educationA. fees. 

Today, he's asking to borrow a loan of $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more supplies. He will also use the loan to rent a new salon in order to expand his business. He notes that these improvements will remarkably increase the family's revenues.

loans.use: To rent a new salon and purchase added supplies

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en:
Cassien is 54 years old and is married with seven children aged between 17 and 34 years old. Cassien owns a business selling jerrycans, sacks, and so on. 

This is his fifth successful year in this business and the hours of his work are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. He currently employs three people to help him. 

Cassien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more jerrycans and sacks to sell. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans, sacks, etc.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and four siblings. He has been working as a painter for the past seven years and is looking forward to growing his business. He works independently in his business and has one part-time employee helping him with the work. 

Today, he's looking to borrow a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase scaffolding in addition to some electrical equipment. He is sure that this loan will help him become more efficient at his work. In the future, he plans to have his own painting shop.

loans.use: To purchase scaffolding in addition to various electrical equipment

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 48-year-old, Lebanese married man living with his wife, parents and two children who are still attending school. He is the main income provider of the family. He is the owner of a small mini-market. In parallel, he has worked as a sales supervisor in a local company since 1998. Today, he’s asking to borrow 1,500 USD from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added foodstuff and provisions for his grocery store. In the future, he plans to purchase a minivan so he will be able to deliver products to the suburbs.

loans.use: to purchase added foodstuff and provisions for his grocery store

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a freelance painter for the past 15 years, sticking with multiple construction projects and private businesses. In parallel, he has worked in a locA. factory since 2009. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs as it is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing life costs. Today, he’s requesting to borrow 1,000 USD from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase painting tools and supplies. He notes that this will increase his business productivity by 10%.

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 49-year-old, Lebanese divorced woman living with her two children who are studying at the university and working at the same time. In 2003, Sanaa started to work as a private teacher receiving students at her home. She works, at the same time, in a local school to be able to afford the heavy expenses. Today, she’s looking to borrow 2,000 USD from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to supply the teaching room with the needed equipment such as teaching tools and board, in addition to a heater so that the students can study properly and comfortably.

loans.use: to supply the teaching room with the needed equipment such as teaching tools and board, in addition to a heater so that the students can study properly and comfortably

loans.name: Ousama

texts.en:
Ousama is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He’s the main source of income for his family and has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. Ousama is a hard worker and always seeks a better life. 

Ousama is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a new car. This will help him carry on his work properly and avoid mechanical problems. He is very optimistic and ambitious to achieve the best in his life.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 34 years old and is married with four children between the ages of one and 14. For the past 17 years, he has made a living selling clothes and shoes. Vincent's business is open from six in the morning through seven at night every day.

Vincent is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to buy more clothes to sell, as his own capital is too low to finance an expansion. He hopes to earn more profit with his loan, which will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business and saving money to become more financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He started to work as a taxi driver in 2005. He’s a very friendly person who has gained a number of loyal customers. 

Ahmad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his car’s engine. He will be able to secure his mode of transportation. In the future, he plans to purchase a van so that he can serve more customers to increase his profits.

loans.use: to repair his car's engine

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still in school. For the past three years, she has been a fish monger and she works from 4 in the morning through 10 at night to make a fair monthly profit. She is a member of the loan group “Forkland,” which is comprised of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

Anna is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her fish stock and finish up her small house.  She used her previous loans to increase her fish stock and to start building a three-room house. Anna has successfully repaid her previous loans. Her dream is to one day own a good butcher shop and also to supply fish to hotels.

loans.use: to buy fish and finish building her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna Elizabeth, de 39 de edad, casada desde hace 17 años, vive en una aldea rural de Santa Bárbara, tiene un hijo de 15 años quien esta estudiando. Su esposo realiza trabajos de construcción adicional a la agricultura.
Doña Mirna, muy trabajadora, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la producción de café, y vende el café en pergamino húmedo. Le dedica el tiempo necesario a esta actividad. Toda su familia se dedica a producir café, pues donde ellos viven es una zona apta para esta producción y además la venta de café esta siendo un negocio muy rentable en el país.
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y es para invertirlo en la siembra de café, incrementando el área de producción y  para cubrir gastos de mantenimiento.
Su plan es seguir ampliando el área de producción para generar mas ingresos y ayudar con la educación de su hijo y apoyo a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth is 39 years old, and she has been married for 17 years.  She lives in a rural village in Santa Bárbara.  She has a 15 year old son who goes to school.  Her husband does construction work in addition to farming.

Mirna is a very hard-worker.  She has worked for 15 year producing and selling wet parchment coffee.  She devotes the necessary time to this business activity.  All of her family produces coffee.  The area where they live is suitable for this production.  Also, selling coffee is currently a very profitable business in the country.

This is the first loan that she has requested.  It is to be used to grow coffee, to increase the area of production, and to cover maintenance costs.

Her plan is to continue expanding the production area in order to generate more income, to help with her son’s education, and to support her family.

loans.use: to grow coffee and for maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Cira

texts.es:
La señora Cira cuenta con 52 años de edad, está casada con el señor Elucino quien es campesino, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos, desde hace mas de 8 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y contar con una solvencia económica, mas estable, y así poder vivir cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como son: leche, sal y cuajo. 
El anhelo más grande que tiene doña Cira, es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y ampliarlo, para así tener una mejor producción y surtido para incrementar un poco mas sus ganancias. 
Esta muy agradecida con Fundación Realidad y los prestatarios de KIVA, por toda la ayuda y la confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio.
texts.en:
Cira is 52 years old and is married to Elucino, an agricultural worker.  The couple have three children who are all married.  Cira's business is making and selling cheese.  She has been in this business for more than 8 years.

Cira says that she started out in this business as she wanted to support her husband with their household expenses and their children's education expenses.  She also wanted to improve their standard of living a little and enjoy more financial stability so that they could live comfortably.  Cira will invest the loan money that she received in buying more supplies such as milk, salt and rennet.

Cira's biggest wish is to be able to further grow and expand her business so that she can enjoy better production and have more stock.  This will enable her to increase her profits a little more.

Cira is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for all the help and trust that they are offering her.  Thanks to the support she has received, both her life and her business have changed a lot.

loans.use: to invest in buying milk, salt and rennet

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula cuenta con 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tienen 3 hijos, Antonio, mariana y enrique, de los cuales solo 2 estudian, están cursando segundo año de primaria y tercer año de preescolar, ya que el mayor esta casado, se dedica a la matanza de marrano y venta de carne, desde hace mas de 7 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida, también tener una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, ya que no contaba con alguien que la apoyara, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de más marranos.
La meta que tiene doña Paula es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es poner una carnicería, para tener más variedad y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le ayudara para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a Fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo”.
texts.en:
Señora Paula is 38 years old and a single mother of 3 children, Antonio, Mariana, and Enrique.  Only two are in school.  One is in the second grade and the other is in preschool.  Her other child is older and already married.  She has been butchering pigs and selling the meat for a living for more than 7 years.  She says that she started this activity because she was looking for a way to provide for her children and this offered them a good quality of life.  She is also financially capable of supporting their studies since she doesn't depend on anyone to support her. 

With the loan she will buy more pigs.  Doña Paula's goal is to grow her business more since what she really wants is to open a butcher shop so she can have more variety and increase her income.  This will help her to support her children's professional studies.  "I am grateful to Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for putting their trust in me and giving me all their support."

loans.use: purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Pilika Group

texts.en:
Shaban, who is in his mid 30s, is married. Of his three children, two of them go to school. He has been operating a small store for four years now where he sells sugar, salt, rice, wheat flour, water, juice and paraffin. He works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Shaban used the previous loan to increase the stock of his business and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock.  His dream is to one day be able to own a big shamba.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Pilika" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more water, juice, more kilos of sugar, rice, wheat flour paraffin and salt.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora alejandrina cuenta con 51 años de edad, esta casada con el señor fortunato, con quien tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados y tiene su propia familia, se dedica ala venta de carne de res y quesos desde hacen 4 años.
Dice que inicio con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y mejorar un poco sus gastos, para tener una muy buena calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de más carne, chorizo y quesos. Para así tener un mejor surtido.
Ella está convencida que uno de sus sueños se podrá cumplir, ya que es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner su carnicería y así tenerlo más surtido, con una amplia variedad de productos, así incrementara y mejorara sus ingresos.
Doña aleja (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) dice que está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, pero sobre todo por la confianza, ya que con esta ayuda ha logrado mejorar el negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 51 years old and married to Fortunato.  The couple have four children who are all married and have their own families.

Alejandrina has been selling beef and cheese for four years.  She says that she started this small business as she wanted a way to support her husband with their household expenses and improve their financial situation a little so that they could enjoy a very good quality of life.  She invested the loan that she received in buying more meat, chorizo and cheese so that she could have more stock available.

Alejandrina is convinced that she will be able to fulfill one of her dreams which is to grow her business much further.  She would like to build premises in which to set up her butcher's shop so that she can house more stock and a wider range of products.  This will increase and improve her income.

Aleja (as she is better known in her community) says that she is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for the great support that they are giving her but, above all, for the trust they are placing in her.  With this help, she has managed to improve her business and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more meat, chorizo and cheese

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo cuenta con 42 años de edad y está casado con la señora yuri, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Roberto, diana y Brenda, de los cuales solo dos estudian, están cursando segundo y tercer año de prepa, ya que la mas pequeña apenas esta por cumplir los tres años de edad, tiene un atienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 5 años.
El dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque buscaba apoyar a su familia, para mejorar su calidad de vida y contar con una buena solvencia económica y así continuar ayudando a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió, lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son leche, aceite, azúcar, sal, refrescos, galletas, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. para tener una amplia variedad de productos.
El sueño más grande que tiene don Ricardo es el de invertirle mucho mas al negocio, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas su local y poner una abarroteria, puesto que así incrementara sus ingresos, y asegurar la educación profesional de sus hijos.
Dice que está profundamente agradecido con los donadores de kiva y fundación realidad, por este gran apoyo y confianza que les están brindando.
texts.en:
Ricardo 42 years old and is married to Yuri, with whom he has 3 children, Roberto, Diana, and Brenda.  Only two of the children are in school, they are in their second and third year of high school, and the smallest is barely three years old.  Ricardo has a grocery stand, which he has had for 5 years.

He says he decided to start this business, as he was looking for a way to support his family, to improve their quality of life, have good financial standing and continue helping their children with their studies.  Ricardo will invest the loan that he received to buy more goods such as milk, oil, sugar, salt, soda, cookies, toilet paper, soap etc. to have a wide variety of products.

Ricardo's biggest dream is to invest more in the business to make it grow faster, because he wants to expand his site a little and install a grocery store, since this will increase their income and ensure a professional education for their children.

Ricardo says he is deeply grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for providing great support and trust in him.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as milk, oil, sugar, salt, soda, cookies, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Don Alcides, de 48 años de edad,  vive en el Espinal una comarca de Estelí, es soltero, su nivel de estudio es básico solo llego hasta tercer grado de primaria, el es agricultor y también se dedica a la ganadería. El aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre quien le enseño todas las actividades propias del campo, comenzó preparando la tierra, después se encargaba de ordeñar y cuidar el ganado así fue adquiriendo experiencia. Hoy en dia tiene 3 manzanas de tierra donde siembra frijol y también tiene vacas, el trabaja junto con su hermano para sacar adelante su negocio. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un novillo. Ya que esto le ayudara para poder trabajar en la preparación y arar la tierra para siembra. Uno de sus planes futuros es tener un finca productora de leche.
texts.en: Alcides is 48 years old and lives in Espinal, a region of Estelí. He is single and has a basic level of education as he only studied up to third grade. Alcides works as a farmer and also raises livestock. He learned this business through his father who taught him agricultural work. He started out preparing the soil and then took charge of milking and caring for the cattle. This is how he gained experience. He now has three manzanas (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of land where he grows beans and also keeps cows. He works together with his brother to get ahead in his business. Alcides needs this loan to buy a young bull. This will help him in his work preparing and plowing his soil to get it ready for sowing. One of his future plans is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, coffee, oil, rice, cosmetics and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith tiene 49 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy amable. Vive en compañía de su esposo y de sus dos menores hijos, por quienes desea ella salir adelante y brindarle una adecuada educación. Los trabajos que realiza Sadith consiste en la venta de ropa a crédito, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima, pues es ahí donde hay mayor variedad y calidad de prendas. Asimismo se dedica a la costura y remendar una que otro ropa de sus clientes. Éste último oficio lo aprendió en un centro ocupacional. Es así que su día laboral empieza con el componer alguna prenda, o confeccionar, ya en la tarde se dedica a vender ropa. En ocasiones cuando necesita de más ingresos, ofrece el servicio de preparar tortas, esto de acuerdo al pedido que le hace sus clientes. Tiene tres años trabajando de esta manera, y en todo este tiempo siempre ha tenido la ayuda incondicional de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que se mantiene ocupada y le genera un ingreso económico que le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Sin embargo, el dejar a crédito la ropa que vende, solo recupera un porcentaje, pues muchos de sus clientes se demoran en pagar. Su mayor anhelo es crecer su negocio y montar una tienda. Este sería el primer credito con MFP, pro tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el dinero recibido lo invertirá en la compra de ropa al por mayor en diversos modelos.
texts.en:
Sadith, 49, is an enterprising, very kind woman.  She lives with her husband and two minor children that she wants to get ahead for and provide an adequate education to.  The work Sadith does is selling clothes on credit, products she brings from the city of Lima because that’s where the greatest variety and best quality clothes are.  

She’s also a seamstress and works repairing one or another article of clothing for her customers.  This latter occupation she learned at an occupational center.  Thus her work day may start with her repairing a piece of clothing or in making an item since the afternoons are spent selling clothes.  Occasionally when she needs to earn extra income she bakes cakes on order for her customers.  She’s been working this way for three years and has had her husband’s unconditional support all this time. 

What she likes about her work is that it keeps her busy and generates income that allows her to cover household expenses and her children’s education.  However, selling her clothes on credit sometimes means only a percentage profit because sometimes her customers take their time to pay her back.  Her greatest wish is to make her business grow and to open a store.

This would be her first MFP loan so she’s hoping for support from all of you.  She will use the money she gets to buy assorted clothes in diverse styles at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 21" television set and school supplies.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 2 enfants n’allant pas à l’école. L’ainé a 15ans et le dernier a 10ans.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle  achète et vend des canaris faites à base d’argile, des balais, des cartes de recharge à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Lomé et travaille seule. 
Afiwa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des canaris, mèches et des cartes de recharge destinées à la vente. Elle  pense diversifier sa marchandise avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait élargir sa clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 50-year-old woman.  She is a widow and the mother of two children who do not attend school.  Her eldest is 15 years old and her youngest is 10.

Afiwa has been working as a retailer since 2004.  She buys and sells clay pots, brooms and top-up cards from her home.  She stocks up at the  wholesalers' in Lomé and works alone.

Afiwa has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy clay pots, hair extensions and top-up cards for resale.  She plans to diversify her merchandise with the extra profits she makes from her business.

Over the coming years, Afiwa would like to enlarge her customer base.  She says that she plans to use her profits to meet her family's food needs.

loans.use: to buy clay pots, hair extensions and top-up cards

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mariposas” esta integrado por seis mujeres cada una D. ellas tiene una actividad es por eso que han pedido el credito ejemplo doña Josefina comprar reces, Maria Esther, Elena, Maria Guadalupe compraran borregos, Ofelia comprara tambien borregos y pollos y Rocio comprara pollos y guajolotes. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas mismas solo que no estaban muy seguras D. ponerle así ya que le querían poner voladoras sin embargo optaron por ponerle “mariposas” ya que les gusto porque es un animal que siempre va hacia delante.
Doña Cristina tiene 48 años D. edad esta casada desD. hace 32 años con el señor Bruno trabaja como albañil juntos han procreado un hijo el cual tiene 11 años se encuentra en sexto año D. primaria su nombre es L., el y sus padres están muy contentos porque esta a punto D. terminar su educación primaria.
Doña Cristina se dedica a la crianza D. los animales con esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 2 borregos y dos puerquitos chicos ella los compra pequeños los crece y luego los venD. hace poco vendió y es por eso que en casa solo tiene tres borregos, comenta que si le sobra comprara zacate y maíz el  precio del maíz le preocupa un poca ya que su precio es muy alto porque el clima afecto el cultivo D. maíz.
El dicha actividad tiene 30 años en todo este tiempo no ha tenido ningún problema ya que siempre ha tratado D. cuidarlos bien y cuando los ve tristes D. inmediato los lleva al veterinario para que los revisen y no se agrave mas.
La meta que tiene la señora Cristina es que su hijo L. termine D. estudiar no solo la primaria sino que pueda llegar ase1r un gran profesionista porque muchas veces ellos se quedan sin dinero y cuando no tiene ellos ya venden uno o más para poder salir del apuro económico.
Las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas, porque llevan ya mucho tiempo trabajando con FRAC están muy agradecidas porque su apoyo ha servido D. mucho sobre todo para salir adelante y mejora su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Mariposas” (Butterflies) group is composed of six women who each has her own activity and this is why they’ve asked for the loan.  For example, Josefina wants to buy cattle, María Esther, Elena, and María Guadalupe will buy sheep, Ofelia will buy sheep too but also chickens and Rocío will buy chickens and turkeys.  They chose the group name themselves but they weren’t too sure about naming it thus because they wanted to call it “Voladoras” but opted for naming it “Mariposas” since they liked it because it’s an animal always headed forward.

Cristina, 48, has been married to Bruno for 32 years.  He works as a bricklayer and together they have a son who is 11 years old and in sixth graD. in elementary school.  His name is L. and he and his parents are very happy because he’s about to finish his elementary education.

Cristina raises animals and this time has requested the loan to buy two lambs and two piglets.  She buys them when they are small and raises them to sell later.  She sold a short while ago so she only has three sheep left at home.  She comments that if she has any money left over she’ll buy pasturage and corn.  
She’s a little concerned about the price of corn because it’s very expensive because the weather affected the corn crops.

She’s been in this business for 30 years and has had no problem in all this time because she’s always striven to care for them well and when she sees them sad she immediately takes them to the veterinarian to be checked over and so that they won’t worsen.

Cristina’s goal is that her son L. finishes his schooling, not only elementary school but that he succeed in becoming a great professional because they run out of money on many occasions and when she runs out is when she sells one or more of them to get out of their economic tough spot.

The members of the group are very grateful because they’ve been working with FRAC for a long time and they are grateful because its help has been very useful for them especially to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and two baby lambs.

loans.name: Lima Group

texts.es:
Isbeidy cuenta con 22 años de edad, es mama soltera tiene un hijo de 3 años se llama Gael Alejandro esta en primer año del preescolar.

Ella se dedica al comercio al comercio de dulces vende dulces fuera de su casa lo cual e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de dulces, jugos, sabritas, etc. Isbeidy dice que le gustaría que su negocio incrementara más y pues ella esta sacándolo adelante para que pueda poner una dulcería y así tener ingresos para ayudar con la educación de su hijo.
	
Isbeidy pertenece al grupo llamado Lima el cual está integrado por 12 mujeres y un hombre a continuación serán mencionados:

Marina, Yolanda, Florencia, Isaid, Lidia, Ma de la Luz, Quirina, Albina, Ma Guadalupe, Lucelia, Tania, Aida, todos se dedican a una actividad comercial como son: venta de dulces, refrescos, frutas y verduras, cosméticos, mercería, papelería, pollos, pan, comida, carnicería, flores, etc.
texts.en:
Isbeidy is 22 years old.  She’s a single mother of a three-year-old son called Gael Alejandro who is in first year of preschool.  She sells candy outside her house and this is what she’ll use the loan for: to buy candy, juice, Sabritas brand snacks, etc.  She says that she’d like her business to grow more and she’s moving it ahead so that she can open a candy store to have income to help with her son’s education.

Isbeidy belongs to a group called “Lima” which has one man and 12 women and who are mentioned following: 

Marina, Yolanda, Florencia, Isaid, Lidia, María de la Luz, Quirina, Albina, María Guadalupe, Lucelia, Tania and Aida are all merchants selling such things as: candy, soft-drinks, fruit and vegetables, cosmetics, notions, stationery goods, chickens, bread, food, meat, flowers, etc.

loans.use: to buy candy, juice, Sabritas brand snacks, etc.

loans.name: Sab Favian Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama san Fabián  y se integra de tres personas quienes cada una se dedica a su actividad  quien se le tomo la entrevista es la señora Miguelina quien es casada con  el señor  Alberto y con quien procreo  cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

   Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de  mercancía como son: frijol, aceite, harina, galletas, jabón, entre otros, ya que le hacen falta algunas cosas que sus clientes  requieren comprar y no tiene, para eso necesita el préstamo y surtirse con esos productos.

   Para iniciar con este negocio lo animo una de sus hijas quien le dio unos centavitos para comenzar y así tener sus propios ingresos para su hogar y es como inicio y ve que le está dando resultados, ya que ha mejorado  un poco mas sus ganancias.

    Lo que ella desea   es que con esta actividad y el préstamo es  seguir trabajando  y que  los prestamistas la sigan apoyando   hasta que dios le preste vida.
 
   Quienes integran en el grupo son las señoras: Rosa Nelly quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de zapatos por catalogo, así también se integra   Nelly Denisse quien también invertirá en la compra de zapatos por catalogo.
texts.en:
The group is called “Fabián” and it’s made up of three people who have their own activities.  The interview was of Miguelina who is married to Alberto with whom she had five children who are all now married.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise like beans, oil, flour, cookies and soap, among others because she needs a few things that her customers need to buy and she is out of and that’s what she needs the loan for to stock up on those products.

To launch this business she was encouraged by one of her daughters who gave her a little money to start out and have her own source of income and that’s how she got started and she sees that it’s producing results and her profits have improved somewhat.   What she wants is that with this activity and with the loans to continue working and that lenders will continue supporting her as long as God keeps her alive.

The group members are: Rosa Nelly who will use the loan to buy shoes via catalogue and Nelly Denisse who will also buy shoes via catalogue.

loans.use: to pay for stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es: Rosio, de 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy amena. Separada de su esposo, pero vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos, a los que quiere mucho en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Rosio, consiste en la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para ello monto una tienda en su propia casa, y cuenta con los principales productos, de esta manera los vecinos ya no tiene que realizar largos tramos hasta el mercado para poder adquirir dichos productos.  Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a esta actividad y hasta el monento siempre ha contado con la ayuda de sus hijos. Ella considera que gracias a su negocio, puede tener un ingreso económico con el que pueda  solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues sola debe velar y asegurar dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Tiene muchos planes, entre ella crecer su negocio. Este sería el crédito dos con la institución MFP, se siente muy bien con su grupo comunal, ya que los que considera como personas responsables y solidarias. Con el préstamo solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará cervezas por cajas, gaseosas, y golosinas para implementar su bodega.
texts.en:
Rosio, 35, is an enterprising, very pleasant woman.  She’s separated from her husband but lives in her own house with her four children who she loves very much.  Rosio’s activity consists in selling basic staple grocery items.  To do so she set up a store at home stocked with the main products and this way her neighbors don’t have to make the long trip to the market to buy said products.  

She’s been in business four years and to date has had help from her children.  She considers that thanks to her business she is able to have income to cover household expenses since she has to care for and insure a better quality of life for her children by herself.  She has many plans and one of them is to make her business grow.

This would be her second MFP loan.  She feels very comfortable with her communal group because she considers them to be responsible, mutually supportive people.  She will use the requested 800 new sol loan to buy beer by the case, soft-drinks and snacks to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy a case of beer, soft-drinks and snacks to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Maize Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maize Group in Western Kenya! Sarah is the facilitator of the Maize group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Sarah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sarah had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Sarah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sarah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Sarah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Maize group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Unga Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Unga Group in Western Kenya! Edwin is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edwin is a father of one child. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits educate his child and ensure food security for his family.
