In the recent 2011 season, Edwin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edwin was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edwin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Edwin will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing and repay his loan.

In 2012, the members of Unga group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Edwin is pictured in the photograph together with his group members and their Field Officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ebenezer Group in Western Kenya! Benson is the facilitator of Ebenezer group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benson takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benson will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ebenezer group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, coffee, oil, rice, cosmetics, and sweets.

loans.name: Wekelekha A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wekelekha A Group in Western Kenya! Jacob is the facilitator of Wekelekha A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jacob takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacob had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jacob was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacob and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Jacob will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Wekelekha A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand and cement, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: María Ceferina

texts.es:
La  Señora Maria  tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive en  la Comunidad del Triunfo de la Cruz en  el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida
Sus hijos están casados y viven por separado en sus hogares. Doña Maria vive sola y se dedica al negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos (maíz, arroz y frijoles), lácteos, golosinas, refrescos y productos de higiene personal.
El negocio lo inicio una de las hijas y posteriormente se lo cedió a ella. Para poder surtir  la pulpería ella solicitó un préstamo pequeño.
En esta temporada, ella ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para abastecer su negocio con productos de primera necesidad, con lo que espera ampliar sus ventas y obtener mayores utilidades.
Considera que su negocio le ha proporcionado estabilidad económica y espera poder terminar de construir su vivienda y reparar el local de su negocio con material de concreto.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old.  She is a single mother, and she has five children,  She lives in the Triunfo de la Cruz community in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.  Her children are married and live separately in their homes.  Maria lives alone.

She has a grocery store where she sells basic grains (corn, rice, beans), dairy products, sweets, soft drinks, and personal hygiene products.  One of her daughters started the business, and she later gave it to Maria.  She requested a small loan in order to stock the grocery store.

At this time she has requested a new loan to stock her store with basic needs products.  By doing so she hopes to increase her sales and get greater profits.

She feels that her business has provided her with financial stability.  She hopes to be able to finish building her house and to repair her place of business with concrete.

loans.use: to buy products (basic grains, sweets, and soft drinks).

loans.name: Namboani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namboani Group in Western Kenya! Lona is the facilitator of the Namboani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lona takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Lona had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 1/2 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lona was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lona and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Lona will educate her children and buy land.

In 2012, the members of Namboani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Cliente de 33 ans,mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui vont tous a l'école. Tres active , elle se reveille de bonne heure s'occupe de son foyer et de son business.Elle est une cliente qui a beneficie de plusieurs prets de Hope, ces credits ont un impact positif sur sa vie sociale et economique et financiere.
Elle a rembourse le prêt avec succès , a fait des épargnes considérables et a  investi favorablement dans l'amélioration des conditions de travail de son salon de coiffure.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va acheter des produits de cosmétiques, tel que defrisants, démêlants, de produits de manucures et pédicures et capillaires des tissages et des perruques.Elle a ajouter en plus du nouveau matériel comme un casque a bain a bain d'huile pour traitement de cheveux.

Pour l'avenir, elle compte ouvrir un autre salon de coiffure dans un autre quartier ,et avec ses benefices elle est entrain d'acheter des équipements pour ouvrir  aussi un institut de beauté. Elle s'occupe valablement de ses enfants et de leur scolarire
texts.en:
This client is a 33-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. A very active woman, she wakes up early every morning to take care of her household and her business. She has benefited from several loans from Hope, and these loans have had a positive impact on her social, economic, and financial life. She has repaid her loans successfully, built up considerable savings, and invested productively in the improvement of her hair salon's working conditions.

With this new loan, she is going to buy cosmetics such as hair straighteners, disentanglers, manicure and pedicure products, hair extensions, and weaves. She also wants to add new equipment such as an oil hair dryer to treat hair.

For the future, she intends to open another hair salon in a different area, and with her profits she is also in the process of buying equipment to open a beauty parlour. She takes care of a significant portion of her children's scholastic and other needs.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty products

loans.name: Amuka Twende Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amuka Twende Group in Western Kenya! James is the facilitator of Amuka Twende group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

James takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, James had a very good maize yield harvesting 7.5 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, James was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, James will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Amuka Twende group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 40 años, es un mujer muy emprendedora. Viven en compañía de su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos a los que quiere mucho. Tiene una casa propia la cual adquirió con el apoyo de su pareja.
La actividad a la que se dedica Nilda es la crianza de ganado vacuno, para ello cuenta con un terreno propio para las 30 vacas que posee, Se siente orgullosa con el trabajo que realiza, ya tiene 5 años continuos y hasta el momento su pareja es quien más la apoyado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad, es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el que pueda cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y así sacar adelante a sus hijos. Sin emnbargo ha tendio inconvenientes con algunos robos de sus vacas, por lo que ahora debe asegurar más su establo. Este sería el crédito número cuatro con MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo que viene recibiendo y considera a su grupo comunal como personas responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. Con el préstamo recibido, comprará más alambre y así mejorar el cerco de su terreno para evitar que le roben otra vaca más.
texts.en:
40-year-old Nilda is a very entrepreneurial woman who lives together with her partner.  The couple have two children who they love very much.  Nilda owns her own home which she acquired with the support of her partner.

Nilda's business is raising cattle and she owns a plot of land where she keeps the thirty cows that she has.  She feels proud of the work that she does.  She has been in this business for five years and, up to now, her partner has been the person who has supported her the most.  What Nilda enjoys about her business is having an income which she can use to cover her household needs and provide for her children.  However, her business has also had problems as she has suffered some thefts of her cows.  For this reason, she must now provide her stable with more security.

This will be Nilda's fourth loan from MFP.  She feels happy with the support that she is receiving and she considers the members of her community bank to be responsible people who are punctual in making their loan repayments.  She will use her loan to buy more wire so that she can improve the fence around her land in order to prevent anybody from stealing another of her cows.

loans.use: to buy wire to fence round her stable

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto, de 76 años de edad, soltero, tiene 6 hijos de 30, 32, 40, 45,47 y 49 años de edad, el vive solo en la aldea Guacamaya, del progreso Yoro.
Debido a su situación, por  falta de una oportunidad de trabajo, decidió establecer un negocio propio  (pulpería), de venta de productos alimenticios de primera necesidad como granos básicos( arroz, sal, azúcar, manteca, especies, pan etc.), carne de pollo, queso, refrescos, churros, etc. 
Este negocio tiene 9 años, gracias a su buena administración y los financiamientos  que a solicitado a ODEF,  a logrado incrementar su inventario. Cuando  inició solo tenia L.150.00 de inventario y ahora lo ha incrementado a  L.30,000.00. 
Este es el cuarto préstamo y han sido para aumentar y mejorar su negocio, de donde está sacando sus ingresos para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 76 years old and single.  His has six children; ages 30, 32, 40, 47, and 49.  He lives alone in the village of Guacamaya in El Progreso, Yoro.

Due to his situation, the lack of the opportunity for work, he decided to establish his own business (grocery store).  He sells basic needs food products (rice, salt, sugar, lard, spices, bread, etc.), chicken, cheese, soft drinks, and churros, etc.

He has had this business for nine years.  Thanks to his good administration and the loans that he has requested from ODEF, he has managed to increase his inventory.  When he started he only had 150 lempiras worth of inventory.  Now it has increased to 30,000 lempiras.

This is his fourth loan.  They have been to increase and improve his business, which is where he gets the income to live better.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products like basic grains, soft drinks, cheese, and chicken, etc.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Bidii Group in Western Kenya! Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Bidii group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph shown above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, oil and fruit.

loans.name: Mkulima Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mkulima SHG Group in Western Kenya! Erick is the facilitator of the Mkulima SHG group. Members of this group joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and 2010 and will re-enroll again in the 2012 program.

Erick is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed the family, to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Erick had a very good maize yield harvesting 25 bags on 1 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Erick was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on 1 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Erick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Erick will save for future use and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Mkulima SHG group will each plant between ½ and 2 acres of maize.

He is pictured with the group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es: Estefita tiene 37 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Estefita es la venta de plátanos, que desde muy temprano se levanta para dirigirse a su puesto que tiene en un mercado de su ciudad. Estando ahí recibe los plátanos que le trae un productor. Tiene seis años de dicándose a esta actividad, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar, además cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Se siente cómoda con la actividad que realiza, pues lo considera rentable ya que tiene una clientela regular que le compran sus productos, de esta manera logra vender todo lo que oferta en su puesto de venta. Tiene ideas de poder hacer crecer su negocio, comprar en mayores cantidades, sabiendo que así tendrá mayores ganancias. Este sería el crédito número diez con MFP. Ella espera contar con su ayuda para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra plátanos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Estefita is 37 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives together with her partner and two children in her own home.  Her business is selling bananas.  She gets up very early in the morning and heads for her stall in the town market.  There she receives bananas which a farmer brings to her.  She has been in this business for six years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  What she enjoys about her business is that it makes her an income which allows her to support her partner with their household expenses and also cover their children's education expenses.  She feels comfortable with the work that she does as she considers it to be profitable.  She has regular customers who buy her products.  In this way, she manages to sell everything that she offers on her stall.

Estefita has ideas of growing her business and buying in larger quantities, knowing that this will make her more profits.  This will be her tenth loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to count on your help so that she can continue in her work.  She will invest the sum she has requested in buying bananas wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bananas wholesale

Judith takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Judith will send her children to school and buy a plot.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Avenida Lopez Avelar Group

texts.es: La señora Carmela tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es taxista, ella tiene dos hijas que estudian la secundaria, ella vende accesorios para dama, C. y niños, ella solicito su crédito para comprar globos grades tipo salchicha, cadenitas, aretes, pasadores, bolsas, bolitas, donas, carteras, cinturones etc., ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años la necesidad la hizo emprender este negocio, su negocio es ambulante sale a vender sus productos en las fiestas de los pueblos vecinos. Su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para ayuda en los gastos de sus hijas que están estudiando, ella está orgullosa de poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, ella utiliza las ganancias del negocio una parte para invertir y otra parte para la escuela de sus hijas. Ella tiene la esperanza de que sus hijas sigan estudiando y lleguen a graduarse en la carrera que a ellas les guste, ella está emocionada con este préstamo que le van a dar, por la oportunidad de comprar mercancía y tener su negocio bien surtido. Las integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por estos préstamos, por la confianza que les tienen y que sigan ayudando a las personas a salir adelante con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmela is 34 years old and married. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have two daughters who attend high school. Carmela sells accessories for women, men, and children. She is requesting a loan to buy balloons (the type shaped like sausage links), chains, earrings, hairpins, bags, marbles, donuts, wallets, belts, and other items. Carmela established this business 15 years ago out of necessity. Her mobile business involves selling her products at festivals held in the neighboring towns. This business is important because the income she earns helps to pay for her daughters’ educational expenses. Carmela is proud of helping her family move forward. She uses part of the profits from her business for investment and the remainder is designated for the schooling of her daughters. Carmela hopes that her daughters will continue their studies and graduate with a degree of their choosing.

She is excited about the loan being granted to her because she will have the opportunity to buy merchandise and have a business that is well-stocked. The members of this group are grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for these loans, the trust that has been given to them, and for continuing to help people move forward with their businesses.

loans.use: to buy balloons, chains, earrings, hairpins, bags, marbles, donuts, wallets, belts, and other items.

loans.name: Toronjil Huazolo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama toronjil huazolo  esta integrado  por nueve integrantes todas son mujeres trabajadoras llenas de sueños e ilusiones .
La señora que salieron por que su negocio no funciono son: Adelfa, Josefina,Ciria,Modesta,Magdalena y Aurora.
Y entraron dos la señora Castula y la señora Violeta.
Una de  las integrantes es la señora Violeta quien se dedica a la venta de blusas y batas típicas  ella tiene  cuarenta y  dos años de edad es madre soltera  pero eso no la hace de menos a pesar de  que no tiene esposo  es una mujer fuerte que siempre logra lo que se propone.
Ella lleva vendiendo ropa desde hace cuatro años lo que mas le gusta  de su negocio es que puede hacer las blusas a su gusto y ponerle diferentes colores y modelo, también le gusta mucho coser a maquina desde chica le llamo mucho la atención .
Tiene un hijo de nueve años de edad  se llama  José Miguel  quien va   a la primaria le gusta ayudar a su mama ya que va entregar la ropa cuando ya esta hecha  y tanbien va a cobrar .
Uno de sus sueños es seguir aprendiendo  cosas nuevas y también a prender  hacer vestidos de novia  de  manta y  de telas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas material como son: Manta, hilo para maquina , blanco y de colores , aros para tejer , agujas  y elásticos para poder elaborar  blusas para mujeres.
Lo que mas le gusta es tejer a maquina ya que le parece algo divertido  y donde puede aprender cosas  nuevas.
 Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
María Divina- quien se dedica a la venta de blusas y servilletas.
Liliana- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Narcisa- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Camelia- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Margarita – quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Acacia- quien se dedica a la  venta de blusas.
Modesta- quien se dedica a la venta de blusas. Servilletas.
Castuela- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha dado ara salir adelante y triunfar en la vida con sus negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Toronjil Huazolo” and consists of nine members, all of whom are hardworking women full of hopes and dreams. The following women have left the group because their businesses are no longer functioning: Adelfa, Josefina, Ciria, Modesta, Magdalena, and Aurora. Two women have joined the group, Sra. Castula and Sra. Violeta.

One of the members is Sra. Violeta, who sells blouses and traditional gowns. She is 42 years and a single mother. Even though she does not have a husband, Violeta is a strong woman who always gets what she wants. She has been selling clothes for four years. What she enjoys most about her business is that she can make blouses to her taste and put different colors and designs. She also likes using her sewing machine because she has been drawn to this activity ever since she was a young girl. Violeta has a nine-year-old son named José Miguel who is in elementary school. He likes helping his mother with delivering the clothes she has made and collecting payments. One of Violeta’s dreams is to continue learning new things and also be able to make wedding gowns.

She is requesting a loan to buy more materials such as cloth, sewing machine thread (white and other colors), knitting hoops, needles, and elastics for making women’s blouses. What she likes most is using a knitting machine because it is fun and it has allowed her to learn new things.

The other members of the group are: • María Divina sells blouses and napkins. • Liliana sells napkins. • Nacariza sells napkins. • Camelia sells napkins. • Margarita sells napkins. • Acacia sells blouses. • Modesta sells blouses and napkins. • Castula sells napkins.

They are grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that has been given to them so that they can move forward and succeed in life and in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy cloth, sewing machine thread, knitting hoops, needles, and elastics.

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Jazmín” las integrates decidieron el nombre ya que en la casa donde se reunen esta un cuadro hermosos de jazmines el grupo está integrado por mujeres trabajadoras todas ella se dedican al comercio y todas han solicitado el crédito para invertir en su negocio. Lizbeth vende guajolotes comprara pequeños para crecerlos y luego criarlos, María Elena comprara borregos igual los crece para luego venderlos, Antonio comprara pollos y guajolotes comprara pequeños para después venderlos, Florentina comprara maíz para sus animales ya que no tiene para darles, Alicia comprara material para construcción ya que tiene una casa de materiales y Margarita de invertirá para su taller de costura.
Maribel tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos Cesar Gustavo de 10 años de edad y Viridiana  de 7 años de edad los dos están cursando la primaria Cesar en quinto grado y Viridiana en tercer grado,  ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que todas las tardes aprovecha su tiempo libre para vender sabanas y colchas, además de vender en las tardes también vende en la escuela primaria de sus hijos por las mañanas, ella cometa que le tiene que echar muchas ganas en su negocio  ya que es muy difícil sostener a dos hijos sola y que además se encuentre estudiando.
En dicha actividad lleva ya 5 años en todo este tiempo su único problema es que en algunas ocasiones se ha quedado sin dinero y no tiene para surtirse antes también otro de sus problemas era cuando daba fiado y no le querían pagar ahora ya no tiene es problema ya que por lo regular siempre ha trabajado con personas está segura que le pagaran , esta vez ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprar invertir en su negocio la señora Maribel calcula que dispondrá tres mil pesos para sabanas y tres mil pesos para colchas.
Una de sus metas que tiene dentro de su negocia es hacerlo crecer pero también quiere empezar a vender zapatos perfumes y toperware por catálogos.
Todas las integrantes del  grupo están muy agradecidas ya que el préstamo que les hacen les ha servido de mucho y sobretodo les ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the “Jazmín” group decided on this name as there are a number of beautiful jasmine trees at the home where they have their meetings.  This group is made up of hard-working women who all work in commerce and have requested this loan to invest in their businesses.

Lizbeth sells turkeys.  She will buy them young, raise them and then sell them.  María Elena will buy lambs to raise and sell, Antonio will buy young chickens and turkeys to sell, Florentina will buy corn for her animals as she doesn't have any to give them, Alicia will buy building supplies as she has a building supplies business and Margarita will invest in her sewing workshop.

Maribel is 32 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children: 10-year-old Cesar Gustavo and 7-year-old Viridiana.  Both of her children are in elementary school.  Cesar is in fifth grade and Viridiana is in third grade.  Maribel is a very hard-working person who takes advantage of her free time every afternoon to sell sheets and bedspreads.  In addition to selling her products in the afternoons, she also sells in her children's elementary school in the mornings.  She says that she has to put a lot of effort into her business as it is very difficult to support her two children on her own and she is also studying.  Maribel has been in her business for five years and, during this time, her problem has been that sometimes she hasn't had money and hasn't been able to stock her business.  Another of her problems has been that she sold on credit and people didn't want to pay her.  Now she no longer has that problem as she always works with people who she is certain will pay her.  On this occasion, she has requested a loan to invest in her business.  Maribel calculates that she will use 3,000 pesos to buy sheets and 3,000 pesos to buy bedspreads.

One of Maribel's goals is to grow her business but she would also like to start selling shoes, perfumes and Tupperware through catalogs.

All the members of this group are very grateful as the loan has helped them a lot and, above all, has helped them to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and sheets

loans.name: Independientes Group

texts.es:
L. señora Esther vive en una ribera pequeña, es casada con el señor  José Iván y con quien procreo un hijo que tiene L. edad D. trece años en primero D. secundaria.

    ElL. se dedica a su hogar   y a su  tienda D. abarrotes en L. que solicito el préstamo  para  invertirlo en  ello ya que le hacen falta algunas cosas que  están un poco altas D. preció y sus clientes lo buscan.


   ElL. se  inspiro  en esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos D. L. casa  y así  también  tener sus  propios ahorros para  comprar cosas que L. hacen falta mejorar su hogar.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad elL.  pueda tener un mejor bienestar para su familia y  agrandar más su negocio con mercancía D. mejor producto.
 
   Las persona que integran en el grupo son L. señora Iddai quien invirtió el préstamo  en L. compra y venta D. marranos, así también se integra L. señora Rosaría quien invertirá el préstamo  en L. compra D. ingredientes para elaborar panes.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther lives on a small embankment along the river. She is married to Sr. José Iván and they have a 13-year-old son who is in his first year of high school. Esther takes care of the home and manages a grocery store. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business because she is lacking a few items. The prices are a little high and her customers are wanting to buy them.

Esther was inspired to start this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and to set asiD. some savings so that she could buy things that were lacking in their home. What she wants most from her business is to be able to proviD. the best for her family’s welfare and to expand her store with more merchandise and better products.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Sra. Iddai will invest her loan in the purchase and sale of pigs. • Sra. Rosaria will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La señora Matilde  tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre con el señor Ramón  y con quien procreo ocho hijos quienes  dos ya están casados y seis aun están a su responsabilidad y viven en una ribera muy pequeña  en una casa muy humilde.



   Ella  es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de materiales, como son: palmas, tintes para elaborar petates, y lleva trabajan quince años  y le va bien ya que también  hace chicharrones para vender  y manda a sus niños a vender de casa por casa  así mejorar un poco mas sus ingresos.

   Para dedicarse a esta actividad de los petates lo  animo su esposo ya que el también los elabora casada que tiene tiempo en cambio ella es todos los días para tener cuando menos tres petates, a un así también  manda a sus hijos vender chicharrones de casa en casa para tener un poco mas de ingresos,

   Lo  que más  desea es que con el préstamo que le han otorgado pueda mejorar su actividad para que con ello siga trabajando con  más calidad y sus ingresos  mejoren  y darles lo más necesario a sus hijos.

Quienes  integran en el  grupo son las señoras:

   Margoth quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra  y venta de pollos, y la señora Antonia  invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
texts.en:
Matilde is 37 years old and in a common law marriage with Ramón. With him she has had eight children, two of whom are married and six of whom are still under her care. They live in a little town on the river in a very humble house. 



She is a housewife and asked for the loan to invest in buying materials such as: palms and dyes to make woven knapsacks. She has been doing this for fifteen years and it is going well for her. She also makes chicharrones to sell and send her children to sell door to door to improve her income a little more.    

Her husband encouraged her to work in the activity of making petates, since he makes them as well, when he has time. She makes at least three a day and still sends her children out to sell chicharrones door to door to have a little more income.     

What she wants the most is that with the loan she has been granted, to improve her activity so that she can work with a higher quality and improve her income, giving her children more of what they need.  

The members of the group are:  

Margoth, who will invest the loan in buying and selling chicken, and Antonia, who will invest the loan in buying ingredients to make bread.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of materials and to make woven knapsacks.

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se  llama las abejitas y se integra de tres señoras quien casada una se dedica a su actividad,  quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama María del Carmen es casada con el señor Jaime y con quien procreo tres hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

 
     Ella  es ama de casa y solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como son. Maíz, aceite, carne, pasas, hoja de guineo, chile ancho, entre, en donde lleva trabajando  seis meses en la que comenta que le va  bien en sus ingresos.

    En esta actividad  la se inspiro por si misma ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar en donde  también su  esposo la a poya para que juntos le den lo más necesario a su hijos y en sus hogar le haga falta algo.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad día con día  mejores sus ingresos para logara a horrar ya si con el tiempo  tener un local en donde vende arroz con leche y tamales.

   La que  integran en el grupo son las señoras: Idolina quien invertirá en la compra de materiales para tejer y bordar y la señora María de Jesús  quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar panes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Abejitas” (The Little Bees) and consists of three married women who are engaged in their individual business activities. The woman who was interviewed is María del Carmen. She is married to Sr. Jaime and they have three children who are their responsibility.

María del Carmen is a homemaker and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as corn, oil, meat, raisins, banana leaves, ancho chiles, and other items. She has been working for six months and says that she has done very well with her income. María del Carmen was inspired to start this business so that she could help her husband with generating household income and providing their children with what they needed most so that they would lack nothing.

What she wants most is to see her small business improve day after day so that she can save some of her income to open a small shop where she can sell rice pudding and tamales.

The other ladies in the group are as follows: • Idolina will invest in the purchase of materials for knitting and embroidering. • Sra. María de Jesús will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making bread.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, meat, raisins, banana leaves, ancho chiles, and other items for making tamales.

loans.name: Furaha B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Furaha B Group in Western Kenya! Protus is the facilitator of the Furaha B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Protus takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Protus had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Protus was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Protus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Protus will educate his children and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Furaha B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aguacatitla Group

texts.es:
Grupo Aguacatitla (que significa lugar de los aguacates)
Doña Lucia es natal de un pueblito cuyo nombre significa piedras acomodadas, su lengua materna es el náhuatl, la señora comúnmente se dedica a las labores del hogar y también lleva a su niña al kínder, pero también atiende un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que inicio desde hace 4 años, ella piensa invertir más pues de esa forma ayudaría a su esposo en los gasto de la familia.
La señora Lucia es líder del grupo Aguacatitla cuyos integrantes son:
María Victoria-juegos de video
Marcolina-perfumeria
Rosa-venta de ropa
El grupo Aguacatitla está felizmente agradecido con KIVA y FRAC por el crédito que les fue otorgado, el cual se está invirtiendo en negocios de comercio, el grupo está totalmente seguro que sus inversiones serán prósperas.
texts.en:
Grupo Aguacatitla (Group of the place of the avocados) Doña Lucia was born in a small village whose name means “adapted stones”. Her mother tongue is náhuatl (an indigenous language). Doña Lucia usually dedicates herself to housework. She also takes her daughter to kindergarten and takes care of her business, a grocery shop that she began 4 years ago. She plans to invest more in the business since in this way she would help her husband with family expenses.

Señora Lucia is the leader of Grupo Aquacatitla whose other members are: María Victoria-video games Marcolina-perfume shop Rosa-clothing sales

Grupo Aguacatitla is very thankful to Kiva and FRAC for the loan, which will be invested in commercial businesses. The group is certain that their investments will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cookies, toilet paper, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tumaini North Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tumaini North Group in Western Kenya! Oscar is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Oscar takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Oscar had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Oscar was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Oscar and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Oscar will ensure food security for his family and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini North group will each plant between ½ and 1 1/2 an acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Celiflora Inocencia

texts.es:
La señora celiflora cuenta con 45 años de edad, está casada con el señor Inocencio, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Alejandro, marina y Alberto, de los cuales solo 2 estudian, la mayor esta cursando el primer año de secundaria y el menor esta en sexto año de primaria, ya que el mas grande esta casado y tiene su propia familia, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, desde hacen 20 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar en algo a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, también para así gozar de una muy buena economía, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: aceite, sal, azúcar, refrescos, leche, jabón, papel higiénico, etc. Y así contar con un mejor surtido de productos.
Uno de los sueños que tiene doña celiflora es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, y brindar un excelente servicio, para así contar con un  mayor número de clientes, y hacerse de más y mejores ingresos.
Dice que este es el mejor apoyo que habían podido darle, ya que gracias  a esto, ahora goza de una mejor calidad de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Celiflora is 45 years old, and she is married to Inocencio with whom she has 3 children, Alejandro, Marina and Alberto. Two of them are in school, with the older one in his first year of secondary school and the younger in the 6th grade of primary school. Her  eldest child is married and has his own family.

She has had a grocery store for 20 years. She says that she decided to begin this business because she wanted to find a way of helping her husband, and her children with their studies, in order for them to have a better future.

In order to take advantage of the economy she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as: oil, salt, sugar, drinks, milk, soap, toilet paper and other items, so she will have a better supply of products.

One of the dreams that Celiflora has is to grow her business, and to provide an excellent service, and so with a larger number of clients, she would have more and better income.

She says that this is the best help that they could give her, because thanks to this, she now enjoys a better quality of life and a good business.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, sugar, drinks, milk, soap, toilet paper and other items

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora magdalena tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con el señor Luís quien es maestro, con el cual tiene 3 hijos miguel, pedro y estela, de los cuales el mayor estudia, el segundo año de secundaria y los dos mas pequeños quinto y sexto año de primaria, ella tiene una farmacia, desde hacen 3 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, por la falta de oportunidades de trabajo, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para gozar de un mejor estilo de vida, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: analgésicos, jarabes, vitaminas, alcohol, algodón, gasas, etc. ya que así contara con una amplia variedad de artículos.
Una de las metas que tiene doña Magda (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad), es la de hacer crecer aun más el negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local para tener bien establecida su farmacia, y así mejorar e incrementar las ganancias.
Estoy muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y la empresa, por todo el apoyo y confianza que nos está brindando,  ya que gracias a esta ayuda contamos con un mejor negocio y forma de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalene is 34 years old and is married to Luís who is a teacher and with whom she has 3 children called Miguel, Pedro and Estela. The oldest is in in the 2nd year of secondary schools, and the two younger ones are in 5th and 6th grades in primary school. 

She has had a pharmacy for 3 years. She says that she decided to begin this small business because of the lack of work opportunities, in order to help her husband with the house expenses and the education of her children, and also in order to enjoy a better life style. 

She plans to use the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as painkillers, syrups, vitamins, alcohol, cotton, gauze, and other products so that she will have a wide variety of items.

A goal of Magda's (as she is known as in her community), is to grow her business, so she wants to build a facility in order to have a well established pharmacy, and thus to improve and to increase her earnings.

“I am very grateful to the Kiva loaners and the community bank, for all the help and the trust given us, and thanks to this help we have a better business and way of life.”

loans.use: to buy painkillers, syrups, vitamins, alcohol, cotton, gauze, and other products

loans.name: Yinyokha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Yinyokha S.H Group in Western Kenya! Samwel is the facilitator of the Yinyokha S.H group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samwel joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samwel had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Samwel was only able to harvest 2.5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samwel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Samwel will ensure food security and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Yinyokha S.H group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the Field Officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda cuenta con 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Faustino quien es maestro, tienen 4 hijos abimael, margarita, Cristian y Juan de los cuales solo 2 estudian, uno esta cursando el primer año de secundaria y el menos sexto año de primaria, ya que los demás están casados, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace  20 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, para así apoyar un poco a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también así hacerse de una mejor solvencia económica y  calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas ropa como: pantalones, faldas, shorts, blusas, camisas, playeras, y ropa interior.
 Ella dice que una de las metas que tiene para su negocio, es la de hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner su tienda de ropa, así mismo mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una carrera.
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva por todo el apoyo que les están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ahora cuenta con un mejor negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old, married to Faustino who is a teacher, and has 4 children called Abimael, Margarita, Cristian and Juan. Two of them are in school. One is in his first year of secondary school and the younger in 6th grade at primary school. The others are married.

She has been in the business of selling clothing for 20 years. She says that she decided to start this business in order to help her husband with the household expenses and her children with school expenses, and also she wanted to have a better economic position and quality of life. She is going to use the money from this loan to buy more clothing such as: pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and underwear.

She says that one of her goals for her business is to make it grow quite a bit, and she would like to build a facility for the clothing store and in this way improve and increase her earnings, and to be able to continue helping her children with their school expenses so that they can have a career.

She is very grateful to the community bank and to the Kiva loaners for all the help they are providing, and thanks to that she now has a better business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and underwear for her business

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora celia cuenta con 40 años de edad, está casada con el señor eliel con quien tiene 6 hijos, Emmanuel, Mauricio, luz, Antonia, martín, amairaní, quienes todos están estudiando, el mayor está cursando el primer año de secundaria, los demás están en segundo, cuarto, quinto y sexto año de primaria, el mas pequeño esta cursando el tercer año de preescolar, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo desde hace 5 años.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quería independizarse un poco y ganar su propio dinero, también para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y contar con una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: labiales, sombras, rubores, cremas, desodorantes perfumes, etc. Para tener mejor surtido.
Doña celia tiene un gran sueño es el de construir un local, para poner su tienda de artículos de belleza, ya que así podrá tenerlo muy bien surtido y contar con una amplia variedad de productos, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ganancias, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el gran apoyo que les están aportando, ya que con esta ayuda ha mejorado su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Celia is 40, and married to Eliel. They have six children: Emmanuel, Mauricio, Luz, Antonia, Martín, And Amairaní, who are all in school. The eldest is in the first year of high school, the rest are in second, fourth, fifth and sixth year of primary, The youngest is in third year of pre-school.

She has been selling cosmetics and perfumes by catalogue for five years. She says she decided invest in this business because she wanted to be a little  more independent and earn her own money. She also wanted to support her children in their studies, and have a better financial situation and quality of life.

She is going to use the loan she received to buy more merchandise, such as lipstick, eye shadow, blushes, creams, deodorants, and perfumes, so that she will have a better supply.

Celia's great dream is to build a permanent location for her beauty products store, as in this way she will be able to have it very well stocked, and have a wide variety of products. In this way she will improve and increase her earnings, in order to ensure her children's future, and help them have a very good professional career.

She is thankful to Fundación Realidad for the great support that they are providing her, as with this help she has improved her business and her family's life.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as lipstick, eye shadow, blushes, creams, deodorants, and perfumes.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora lizbeth tiene 19 años de edad, y está casada con el señor francisco, con quien tiene 1 hijo, se llama Eduardo apenas tiene 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hacen más 2 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque está buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su pequeño, también para contar con una buena solvencia económica y una mejor calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: camisas, playeras, camisetas, blusas, vestidos, shorts, faldas, ropa interior, etc. Y así tener un poco mas surtido.
Doña liz (así es como le dicen sus familiares), comenta que el más grande propósito que tiene para su negocio, es el de hacerlo crecer  mucho mas, ya que quiere construir un local y poner su tienda de ropa, puesto que así aumentara sus ganancias, para asegurar la educación de su hijo.
Ella está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por esta ayuda que les están ofreciendo, ya que les beneficia muchísimo.
texts.en:
Lizbeth, 19, is married to Francisco with whom she has one child, Eduardo, who just turned two. She has been selling clothes for more than 2 years. She says that she decided to start this business because she was looking for a way to help her husband with the costs of the home and to offer her son a better future. She also wanted to have good financial credit and a better quality of life.

The loan that she received will be used to buy more merchandise like shirts, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, skirts, underwear, etc, so that she can have more inventory. 

Liz (as she's known to her family) says that her biggest goal for her business is to make it grow so that she can build a store to sell her clothes. This will increase her earnings so that she can ensure her son's education. She is very thankful to the Kiva and FRAC donors for the help they've offered her because it benefits her so much.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like blouses, t-shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Divina

texts.es:
La señora divina cuenta con la edad de 41 años y está casada con el señor senon con quien tiene 3 hijos, Abel, Marisol y Pablo de los cuales los 3 están estudiando, cursan segundo, quinto y sexto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hacen mas de 12 años.
Dice que se animo a invertir en este negocio, ya que quería buscar la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también para gozar de un mejor nivel de vida, al igual que una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas plátanos, manzanas, duraznos, melones, papayas, jitomates, tomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, etc.
Doña divina comenta que uno des retos que tiene en su negocio es el de hacerlo crecer un poco más, ya que quiere ponerse frutería, para así tener una amplia variedad de productos, e incrementar y mejorar sus ventas junto a sus ingresos, puesto que le ayudaran a seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
“Estoy muy agradecida con fundación realidad por este gran apoyo que me han dado, ya que podré ampliar un poco más mi negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con mi familia”. Gracias
texts.en:
Divina is 41 years old and married to Senon.  The couple have three children: Abel, Marisol and Pablo.  All three of their children are in school.  They are in the second, fifth and sixth year of elementary school.  Divina has been selling fruit and vegetables for more than 12 years.

Divina says that she decided to invest in this business as she wanted a way to support her husband with their household expenses and their children's education expenses.  She also wanted to enjoy a better standard of living and good financial solvency.  She will invest the loan that she has been given in buying more bananas, apples, peaches, melons, papayas, tomatoes, chilis, onions, potatoes, etc.

Divina says that one of the challenges she has in her business is growing it a little more.  She would like to set up a greengrocer's shop so that she can offer a wide range of products and increase and improve her sales and income because she and her husband will continue supporting their children with their higher education.

"I am very grateful to Fundación Realidad for this great support that they have given me as I will be able to expand my business a little further and enjoy a better quality of life together with my family.  Thank you".

loans.use: to buy more bananas, apples, peaches, melons, papayas, tomatoes, chilis, onions, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
La señora amada cuenta con 30 años de edad y está casada con el señor Andrés quien es electricista, con el cual tiene 4 hijos, Abelardo, José Antonio, mariana y Gilberto de los cuales, los 4 estudian el mayor esta cursando el primer año de secundaria y dos mas están en cuarto y quinto año de primaria, ya que el menor esta en tercer año de preescolar primer, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos  mexicanos, desde hacen más de 8 años.
Ella comenta que decidió iniciar con esta pequeña actividad, ya que quería independizarse un poco y buscar la manera de apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como son: jitomates, chiles, cebollas, carne, pollo, maíz, lechuga, aguacate, papas, quesos, aceite, sal, etc. Y así seguir con la preparación de sus ricos antojitos.
Doña amada dice que la meta que tiene para su negocio, es de hacerlo crecer mucho mas, ya que quiere poner un comedor económico, para así contar con una amplia variedad de platillos, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, para comprar sillas y mesas, ya que también podrá continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores.
Da las gracias a FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, y sobre todo por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Amada is 30 years old and married to Andrés, who is an electrician.  The couple have four children: Abelardo, José Antonio, Mariana and Gilberto.  All four of their children are in school.  The eldest is in the first year of secondary school and the next two are in the fifth and fourth year of primary school.  The youngest is in the third year of pre-school.  Amada's business is making and selling Mexican snacks.  She has been in this business for more than eight years.

Amada tells us that she decided to start this small business because she wanted to become a little more independent and find a way to support her children in their studies.  She will invest the loan that she received in buying more supplies such as tomatoes, chilis, onions, meat, chicken, corn, lettuce, avocados, potatoes, cheese, oil, salt, etc.  This will enable her to continue preparing her delicious snacks.

Amada says that her goal for her business is to grow it much further.  She would like to set up a cheap eatery so that she can offer a wide variety of dishes and thereby improve and increase her profits to buy tables and chairs.  This will enable her to continue supporting her children in their higher education.

Amada thanks FRAC (Fundación Realidad) and Kiva lenders for this great support that they are giving her and, above all, she thanks them for placing their trust in her.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as tomatoes, chilis, onions, meat, chicken, corn, lettuce, avocados, potatoes, cheese, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Group in Western Kenya! Hudson is the facilitator of the Bidii group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Hudson takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Hudson had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hudson was only able to harvest six bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hudson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Hudson will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph shown above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Laguna Chica Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Antonia es uno de los miembros D.  grupo llamado Laguna chica el cual esta integrado por dies personas la cuales son muy trabajadoras y amables, Doña Maria antonia tiene la edad de 53 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se madre soltera de 5 hijos, solo depende de ella unos de sus hijos que se encuentra estudiando el cuarto semenstre de telebachillerato. Ella platica qe desde hace  un año tres meses inicio con su negocio de comida economica  porque quiere sacar adelante a su hijo dandole estudios y brindandelo una mejor calidad de vida, ademas de que dice que hay que trabajar muy fuerte para salir adelante ya que la situacion economica es cada vez mas dificil.

Ella nos comenta como lleva a cabo su negocio de comida economia,  levantandose desde muy temprano para preparar sus alimentos, cocina una variedad de comidas tipicas de su region, pone unas cuantas sillas y mesas en su negocio y espera a que lleguen sus clientes, se encuentra muy contenta porque dia a dia va teniedo mas clientes.

Doña Maria Antonia necesita este credito para la compra de tortillas, variedad de chiles, carne, sal, aceite, tomate, cebolla, ajo, cilantro,  Col, masa, frijoles, arroz y gas para posteriormente realizar su negocio y poner sus alimentos a la venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere pues quiere seguir con su negocio ya que le da la oportunidad de sacar adelante a su familia, tambien comenta que se encuentra muy contenta con la fundacion por la oprtunidad que le esta dado.

Los demas miembros D. grupo son: 
Rafaela-venta de antojitos mexicanos
Claudia-venta de ropa 
Mariscotit-venta de zapatos 
Lidia-venta de ropa 
Iris Janeth-venta de antojitos mexicanos
Reyna-club de nutricion
Maria D. Rocio-venta de abarrotes 
Guillermina-venta de dulces
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is one of the members of a group called Laguna Chica, which is made up of ten people who are very hardworking and friendly. Maria Antonia is 53 years old. She went to school until secondary school, and is the mother of 5 children. Only one of her children is still dependent on her and is in his fourth semester of distance learning high school. She tell sus that a year and three months ago she started her low cost food business because she wants to get her son ahead, giving him an education and offering him a better quality of life. She also says that she has to work very hard to get ahead since the economy is always getting worse.  

She tells us how she does her low cost food business. She gets up very early to prepare her food, cooking a variety of traditional food from her area. She sets out some chairs and tables in her business and waits for customers to arrive. She is very happy because she has more customers every day.  

Maria Antonia needs this loan to buy tortillas, a variety of chiles, meat, salt, oil, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, cabbage, meal, beans, rice and natural gas to do her business and sell her food.

She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper because she wants to continue with it. It gives her the opportunity to get her family ahead. She also tells us that she is very happy with the Foundation for the opportunity it is giving her.  

The rest of the members of the group are: 
Rafaela-selling Mexican snacks
Claudia-selling food
Mariscotit-selling shoes 
Lidia-selling clothes
Iris Janeth-selling Mexican snacks
Reyna-nutrition club
Maria D. Rocio-selling groceries 
Guillermina-selling candies

loans.use: to buy tortillas, a variety of chiles, meat, salt, oil, tomato, onion, garlic, cilantro, cabbage, meal, beans, rice, and natural gas.

loans.name: Los Ficus Group

texts.es:
El Grupo el ficus esta integrado por dies personas las cuales son muy alegres, trabajadoras y amables,ELa señora Laura es una de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se enceuntra casada con el señor Gilberto que tiene el oficio de carpintero,tiene 3 hijos, y solo uno de sus hijos depende de ellos. Ella comenta que desde hace unos meses decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de abarrotes porque penso en apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y ademas piensa que su negocio le ayuda mucho a salr adelante a futuro.

Ella realiza su venta de abarrotes todos lo dias desde muy temprano se pone a limpiar su tienda, en ella tiene todos su productos de abarrotes donde los acomoda en unos anaqueles y los pone en miestra para sus clientes, se encuentra muy contenta con su negocio ya que dia a dia cuenta con mas clientes.

Doña Laura necesita este credito para la compra de aceite, dulces, pan, productos enlatados, jugos, refrescos, frijoles, arroz, pan molido, cloro, jabon , detergente, veladoras y jabon de baño para posteriormente ponerlo a la venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio pueda prospera y salir adelante ya que desea su negocio sea una de las tiendas principales de abarrotes de su comunidad.
"Gracias Fundacion Realidad por el apoyo que me han dado a mi y mi familia"


Los demas integrantes de este grupo son:
Patricia- Antojitos Mexicanos
Elizabeth- Cosmeticos
Maria- Cosmeticos
Yolanda- Refrescos
Carolina-Cosmeticos
Yolanda-Carpinteria
Ana Celia- Cosmeticos
Rosa-Ropa
texts.en:
The 'El Ficus' group has ten members who are very cheerful, hard-working and kind.  Laura is one of the members of this group.  She is 33 years old and studied up to high school level.  She is married to Gilberto, who works as a carpenter, and the couple have three children.  Only one of their children is still dependent on them.  Laura tells us that she decided to start her business selling groceries a few months ago as she wanted to support her husband with their household expenses and also because she believes that her business will help her to get ahead in the future.

Laura sells her groceries every day.  She starts work very early in the morning, cleaning her store.  She keeps all her grocery products in her store.  She puts them on display on shelves for her customers.  She is very happy with her business as she gains new customers every day.

Laura needs this loan to buy oil, sweet treats, bread, canned food, juice, soft drinks, beans, rice, bread crumbs, bleach, soap, detergent, candles and bath soap to sell.

Laura hopes that, with this investment, her business will thrive and that she will make progress as she would like her business to become one of the main grocery stores in her community.

"Thank you Fundación Realidad, for the support that you have given to me and my family".

The other members of this group are:
Patricia - Mexican snacks
Elizabeth - Cosmetics
María - Cosmetics
Yolanda - Soft drinks
Carolina - Cosmetics
Yolanda - Carpentry
Ana Celia - Cosmetics
Rosa - Clothes

loans.use: to buy oil, sweet treats, bread, canned food, juice, soft drinks, beans, rice, bread crumbs, bleach, soap, detergents and candles

loans.name: Citlali Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Citlali esta integrado por 15 mujeres muy alegres y trabajadoras,ellas decidieron ponerle a su grupo  un nombre en su dialecto nahuatl Citlali que significa estrella.


La señora Claudia es una D. los miembros D. este grupo, ella tiene la edad D. 35 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Carlos que trabaja en el campo, tienen 6 hijos D. nombres Flor del Rio que tiene 17 años  David que tiene 15 años y ambos estudian la preparatoria, Carla tiene 13 años y estudia la secundaria, Luz del Carmen tiene 11 años y Maria Dolores estudian la primaria y Pedro D. 5 años estudia el preescolar. Ella comenta que desD. hace 3 años inicio con su venta D. abarrotes porque quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y la unica herencia que les pueD. dar es mandandolos a la Escuela y darles una buena educacion es por eso que ella trabaja muy fuerte ademas D. ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar.

Doña Claudia realiza su venta D. abarrotes, abriendo su tienda desD. muy temprano, para esperar a que su clientes que lleguen, ella puso todos sus productos en unos anaqueles donD. muestra a sus clientes sus productos y ella los atienD. con mucho gusto.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra D. jabon en polvo, jabon para baño, detergentes, frijol, arroz, maiz, productos enlatados, refrescos, jugos, dulces, aceite, dulces y pan para posteriormente ponerlos a la venta en su negocio.

Doña Claudia espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y pueda aumentar aun mas su negocio, ademas D. que se encuentra muy contenta con la fundacion que manda un mensaje en su lengua materna que es el  nahuatl: "Tlaxokamati Fundacion Realidad" (que significa Gracias Fundacion Realidad).

Los demas intergrantes del grupo son:
Elizabeth- Refrescos
Maximina-Ropa Interior
Julia-Ropa Interior
Hortensia-Refrescos
Concepcion-Pollo
Maria Magdalena-Abarrotes
Asela-Dulces
Angelica-Dulces
Catalina-Refrescos
Ernestina-Refrescos
Zeferina-Pollo
Minerva-Carpinteria
Marisol-Pollo
Claudia C.-Refrescos
texts.en:
The Citali group is maD. up of 15 very cheerful and hard-working women who decided to give their group a name (Citali) which, in their Nahuatl dialect means 'Star'.

Claudia is one of this group's members.  She is 35 years old, studied up to high school level, and is married to Carlos who is an agricultural worker.  They have six children: 17-year-old Flor del Rio, 15-year-old David (both of whom are in senior high school), 13-year-old Carla (who is in high school), 11-year-old Luz del Carmen and Maria Dolores (who are in elementary school) and 5-year-old Pedro who is in pre-school.  Claudia tells us that she started her business selling groceries three years ago because she wanted to proviD. for her children and the only inheritance she can give them is to send them to school and give them a good education.  For this reason, she works very hard.  She also wants to help her husband with their household expenses.

Claudia opens her grocery store very early in the morning and waits for her customers to arrive.  She has all her products out and displayed on shelves so that her customers can see them.  She enjoys serving her customers.

Claudia needs this loan to buy powdered soap, bath soap, detergents, beans, rice, corn, canned food, soft drinks, juice, candies, oil and bread to sell in her business.

Claudia hopes that, with this investment, her business will thrive and she will be able to increase her business even further.  She is very happy with the foundation and sends them a message in her mother tongue (Nahuatl).  "Tlaxokamati Fundación Realidad" (Thank you Fundación Realidad).

The other members of this group are:
Elizabeth - Soft drinks
Maximina - Underwear
Julia - Underwear
Hortensia - Soft drinks
Concepción - Chicken
Maria Magdalena - Groceries
Asela - Sweet treats
Angelica - Sweet treats
Catalina - Soft drinks
Ernestina - Soft drinks
Zeferina - Chicken
Minerva - Carpentry
Marisol - Chicken
Claudia C. - Soft drinks

loans.use: to buy powdered soap, bath soap, detergents, beans, rice, corn, canned food, soft drinks, juice, candies, oil and bread

loans.name: Flor De Tulia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Flor de Tulia está conformado por las señoras Cristina y Alejandrina van a comprar con su préstamo arroz, aceite, huevo, frijol, chiles, papas, tortillas, verduras y carnes, para la elaboración de comida, la señora francisca va a comprar abono químico, herbicidas para su siembra de maíz, las señoras Alejandra y Reyna van a comprar una carga de maíz, la señora Claudia Arlena va a comprar catálogos y zapatos para dama, las señoras Anabel, Florencia y Sandra van a comprar fertilizantes y abono para su siembra de jitomate, tomate, frijol. La señora Francisca tiene 50 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos 2 mujeres y 1 hombre todos mayores de edad, ella siembra maíz, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, la renta de maquinaria para barbechar y sembrar el maiz y una parte para cambiar el motor de la camioneta, su negocio es importante porque en este negocio gana dinero, ella está orgullosa de ser campesina que le gusta ir a trabajar al campo junto con su esposo y su hija a ella le gusta cuando cosecha el maíz, frijol, jitomates o tomates lo lleva a vender a la central, ella recuerda que de este negocio levanto su casa y ha podido salir adelante, su negocio es popular porque en este pueblo todos son campesinos siembran el jitomate y tomate, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocios es el costo del producto hay veces que lo pagan muy barato, ella utiliza las ganancias para los gastos de su casa, para comprar cerdos y pollos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijos esten bien que vivan contentos con sus familias.
las integrantes del grupo estan muy agradecidas con Kiva y Fundacion Realidad por la confianza al proporcionarles estos creditos tan buenos para crecer los negocios y las familias.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Flor de Tulia' and it is made up of the following ladies: Cristina and Alejandrina, who will use their loan to buy rice, oil, eggs, beans, chilis, potatoes, tortillas, vegetables and meat for making food; Francisca, who will buy chemical fertilizers and herbicides for her corn crop; Alejandra and Reyna, who will buy a load of corn; Claudia Arlena, who will buy catalogs and ladies' shoes; and Anabel, Florencia and Sandra, who will buy fertilizers and manure for their tomato and bean crops.

Francisca is 50 years old, married, and has three grown-up children (two daughters and one son).  Her business is growing corn.  She requested this loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer and herbicides, and to hire machinery for plowing her land and sowing her corn.  She will also use part of her money to replace the engine in her truck.  Her business is important because it earns her money.  She is very proud to be a farmer and she enjoys working in the fields together with her husband and her daughter.  She enjoys harvesting her corn, beans or tomatoes which she then sells.  She tells us that this business enabled her to build her house and get ahead in life.  Her business is popular because in this village everybody works the land, growing tomatoes.  The challenge that Francisca faces in her business is the amount she receives for her crops.  Sometimes they pay her very little.  She uses the profits that she makes to cover her household expenses, to buy pigs and chickens.

Francisca's hopes and dreams are for her children to do well and live happily with their families.  The members of this group are very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the trust that is being placed in them by giving them these loans which are so good for growing their businesses and supporting their families.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers and herbicides for her corn crop

loans.name: Farm Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Farm Group in Western Kenya! Kennedy is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Kennedy is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Kennedy had an excellent maize yield harvesting 32 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Kennedy was only able to harvest 17 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kennedy and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Kennedy will educate his children and ensure food security for his family.

In 2012, the members of Farm group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Coumba habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 48 ans  et s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le commerce et la vente de tissus, d’accessoires de  femmes et autres produits divers.
