loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old. Esmeralda is single and has one child.

The loan obtained by Esmeralda in her third loan cycle is used to repair her vehicle for better service. She was glad to be able to repair her transport vehicle to earn a living. The income generated is good and she was able to payback her loan. Now Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to buy a repossessed motorcycle for transport as a supplementary source of income. 

Esmeralda has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a repossessed vehicle to be used for "habal-habal" transport business

loans.name: Gulbarchyn's Group

texts.en:
Gulbarchyn is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up four daughters. Her two older daughters study at school and the younger daughters are preschool age (under seven years old). 

Three years ago, with an initial investment of 3000 soms, Gulbarchyn opened a small kiosk and started to sell home products. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more oil, tea, sugar and macaroni in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future, with the profits gained from trading, Gulbarchyn wishes to build a nice grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, tea, sugar and macaroni.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is married with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in Sto. Nino,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a fisherman. Epifania sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for more than ten years.

Each month she earns Php 5,000. She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase a pump boat machine to use for fishing.

Epifania is a hardworking, responsible woman who, many years ago, found herself needing to sell seafood to help her husband support the household. She goes out every morning at 5 AM, when her husband comes in from the sea, and she directly sells the catch in her local market or door-to-door in neighborhoods near the market. 

Epifania has been a good member of GDMPC for more than three years. In the future, she is hoping that her business will expand and she can use her  profits for her children's education..

loans.use: To purchase pump boat machine

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya, 26, is a resident of Ananievo – a small village in the Isykul region. Her husband works in Kazakhstan, so she brings up her seven-year-old son, by herself. Her son goes to school. Aliya sells clothes as her livelihood. She started this activity two years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 soms. She earns about 6,000 soms per month. This profit enables her to purchase household appliances to improve their living conditions. With the money received from the loan, Aliya wants to purchase more clothes for trade. She plans to increase her turnover and improve the selection of clothing which she sells. In the future she wishes to expand her business and save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for trade

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet spends most of her time managing her small store in front of her house. She has been patiently involved in this business for almost two years. She sells sugar, coffee, milk, biscuits, shampoo, eggs and other basic kitchen ingredients. Juliet earns PHP 3,000 monthly. 

She is now 51 years old and has two children attending tertiary education. 

Juliet needs to buy more groceries to increase her sales capacity but she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, sardines, and detergents to sell in her store.  

In the future, Juliet wants to keep growing as an entrepreneur and continuously provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, sardines, and detergents to sell in her store.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is from the village of Capellan, in the province of Isabela. She is 48 years old. Teodora is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Teodora owns and operates specialized retail store. She sells a variety of products and fruits in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately P4,200 a month.

Teodora is requesting a new loan of P 24,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods, canned goods and drinks.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, spices and drinks

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania is from the village of Capellan. She is 56 years old and married with adult-aged children.

Estefania owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products like snack foods, drinks, coffee and sugar in the local community. With her vending business, she earns approximately P 6,000  a month.

She is requesting a new loan of P 10,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, coffee, sugar, soy sauce and drinks for her store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and from the village of Capellan, in the province of Isabela. She is engaged in a retail business where sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and coffee. Rosita is a hardworking mother and tries to do everything for her family.

Rosita is asking a loan of P 13,000 to purchase different products like shampoo, soap, toothpaste and snacks to sell for additional income.

In the future, Rosita dreams that someday she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, toothpaste, coffee and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Nellieflor May

texts.en:
Nellieflor May is a mother who has three school-age children. She and her husband both pay for the education of their children. She enjoys cooking and selling meals and snacks in their community. She hopes to improve the business to be able to satisfy her customers' needs and to increase her income. She mentioned that their children are in need of financial support for they are now in secondary and tertiary levels at school. 

She is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings for her food stall. She believes that through this loan, she can  improve her business. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand the business and make it viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in her food stall

loans.name: Leonilyn

texts.en: Leonilyn is a married woman with one child. She is 28 years old and lives at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past eight years, Leonilyn has run her general store, selling a variety of products. Each month, she earns 335,100. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase products to resell. Leonilyn has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Leonilyn wants to improve and expand her business and to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and lives in San Vicente, Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 
Marilyn has a fish-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is married and 29 years of age. She is very supportive and sews clothes to financially support her family. 

She is very good in her work and receives regular orders every month. The income she earns helps to pay her utility bills and other daily expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Neither of them has yet to start his/her education due to financial constraints.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her brother-in-law’s business of selling cigarettes, betel leaves and cold drinks etc. With the loan, he will buy cold drinks, cigarettes and betel leaves in large quantities that will allow him to sell in larger quantities and increase his profits. He started his business 4 years ago and he is confident that after the loan investment he will be able to upgrade his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, betel leaves and cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is married with 3 children. She is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Joaquina is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy piglets for her piggery.

Joaquina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Joaquina hopes to be a supplier of pigs in the province.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her piggery.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 22 years old and still single. He lives with his parent at the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. At his age, Robert has been able to manage their corn field for two years and with his hard work he has been able to earn about PHP 10,000 per crop season.

Robert is a local farmer cultivating their corn field. He would like to improve the soil of their farm by using the chemicals needed to be more productive. Because of his determination for his family's situation, he would like borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP 27,000, which will be used to buy farm inputs to improve his corn field business. He hopes that he can maintain his farm business for his future and do so with his whole family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to improve his corn field business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with 5 children. Fe is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fe is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase piglets for her piggery. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Fe hopes to be a number one supplier of pork meat in the Philippines.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for her piggery.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a responsible and jolly person who is engaged in a corn farm business. He has been in this business for 15 years. He earns approximately PHP 30,000 every harvest season for these activities. Rolando is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. He is 47 years of age, and is married to a housewife who takes care of their children. At this time, Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides to supplement his corn farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requests to further grow his farm business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 35 and a responsible house wife who owns and manages an eatery near the school campus. She cooks food for meals and snacks that she offers to her customers in their community. Despite many competitors in the area, she still has the determination to improve her business.

In the future, Charito hopes that her four children will become professionals and her business will grow and become more profitable. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy soft drinks, grocery items, rice, pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in her eatery. She believes that she can improve the business by working hard and striving harder.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, grocery items, rice, pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in her eatery.

loans.name: Hedalie

texts.en:
Hedalie is married with 3 children. Hedalie is 33-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Hedalie owns and operate a banana and copra production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earn PHP 2,500 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase pesticides and to pay the costs of banana planting.

Hedalie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Hedalie hopes to expand her production business and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and to pay the cost of banana planting.

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en:
Sarkis is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is the only income source for his family and he works hard to enhance his family's lifestyle.

He has 15 years experience working in printing designs on textiles. And in 2009, he was able to open his own shop. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more products needed for his printing work. In the future, he plans to broaden his business operations and include more designs.

loans.use: to purchase more products needed for his printing work.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children; one of them is still studying. The whole family cooperates to cover the heavy costs of life.

Michel has been working in the construction field since 1997. Over the years he was able to build a good business reputation. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase wood for his construction work. In the future, he plans to open his own construction office.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his construction work.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 35 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Elvie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase stock for her general store. 

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Elmera

texts.en:
Elmera is married with four children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elmera owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year and every month she earns 2,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell.

Elmera has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Elmera hopes to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en: Mansour is a 48-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He is the main provider of his family's income. He has 15 years' experience working in the construction field and has chosen to work on his own since 2001. With the loan of $1600 that he has requested from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to buy wood and other construction materials. As for his future plans, Mansour looks forward to working with more customers and earning a higher income.

loans.use: To buy wood and other construction materials.

loans.name: Khursheedan's Group

texts.en:
Khursheedan is 46 years old and spends most of her time staying at home and fulfilling her household responsibilities. 
Her husband is a salesman and sells edible items (candies, snacks, etc.) to different shops. He is very hardworking person and works for long hours to earn money for his family.
Khursheedan has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy foods in larger quantities that will allow him to fulfill his customers' demands and increase his profits and sales.
He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Khursheedan is confident that an investment will help her husband make positive changes to his business and increase his profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheedan.

loans.use: to buy edible items (candies, snacks, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny manage his corn field patiently to earn a living. He is 31 years old and married with only one child. He devotes his time to cultivating and maintaining his corn field so that his profit will increase. His wife is still in college.

Johnny has been managing his farm for almost 13 years but still needs additional capital to maintain it and increase his yields. For these reasons, he would like a loan amounting to P27,000. This amount would really help him, especially in supporting the education of his wife and their daily needs. He is hoping that someday he could be financially stable and he could save some money for the future of their only child.

loans.use: to maintain his corn farm.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto is 53 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children. 
Gilberto sells different kinds of fish. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more fish for sale.
Gilberto has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Gilberto hopes to improve his house.

loans.use: to purchase different fish for sale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Through patience and hard work, Melanie believes that she will improve their quality of life and give her family a better life. She is 33 years old and has two school-aged children. Despite being a widow, she is confident enough to continue sending her children to school. To earn a living, Melanie cooks and sells snacks in their village. 

She aims to strengthen her business and make it a viable source of income. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy sugar, milk, tamarind, flour, food coloring, and gelatin. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tamarind, flour, food coloring and gelatin

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en: Hermenia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. Hermenia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas. Hermenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hermenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas

loans.name: Abdel Kader

texts.en: Abdel Kader is a 36-year-old Lebanese single man living on his own. After 12 years of experience working in the agricultural field, he started his own business in 2002. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase materials needed in order to build new high-quality plastic tents in his land. He notes that after suffering damages caused by bad weather, these plastic tents will help him avoid unexpected problems. In the future, he plans to cultivate varied vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: To build new high-quality plastic tents to protect his crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and has three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Yei South Sudan for five years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase maize and ground nuts. She hopes to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, ground nuts, and avocado for sale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and three siblings. He has been involved in the construction field for the past six years. He works on a freelance basis and his job is specialized in floor covering.

Today, he is asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electrical generator for his business. This will help him respond rapidly for his customer’s demands and allow him to complete his tasks punctually.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical generator for his business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Imelda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en: Kimberly is a married woman with two children. Kimberly is 26 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Kimberly operates a retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Kimberly has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Kimberly wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Ghanem is a tailor, he has owned a workshop since 2004, making, repairing, or altering clothing such as suits, coats and trousers for women and men. He has more than four years of experience in this field, and a deep understanding of the needs of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a tailoring machine, to build a display case and to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine, build a display case and pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 51-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children. She has owned a bakery since 2009 and produces tasty pastries. She has worked for 21 years. Despite her older age and since her income is limited, her husband who works outside the country, helps her with the household expenses especially with the heavy educational fees. With her requested loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will be able to increase her inventory of food products such as flour, sugar and other ingredients. She has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products such as flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en: Melisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She also offers a shoe repair service part-time. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. Melisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 56 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. She has a fish vending business from which she earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to own a fishing boat.  She is a hardworking mother and she wants to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
At the young age of 18, Jacqueline had already settled into marriage and was living separately from her parents. She was not able to seek employment, so she engaged herself in a retail business to earn income and make a living. She usually earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month and uses the money to pay for her children's school fees, room and board, and allowances.

Jacqueline is now 31 years old and has four children. Her family lives under less fortunate circumstances but is happy to be together. Jacqueline is now requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, soap, and detergent for resale in her store. She hopes these additional grocery items will increase her sales capacity.

Jacqueline hopes to strengthen and improve her sales from her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, soap, and detergent for resale

loans.name: Bestia

texts.en:
Bestia is 45 years old and a married woman with nine children, six of whom are in school. She has had a grocery store business in Yei, South Sudan, for seven years.

Bestia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize, ground nuts for sale. She hopes to use thee extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize and ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Presencia

texts.en: Presencia is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & coconut wine. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & coconut wine.  Presencia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & coconut wine

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina is an embroidery expert. She is very skillful and produces beautiful embroidered clothes that she sells for a reasonably good profit. She is the mother of 4 sons, all of whom are young and do different kinds of work to financially support the family.

Nagina's husband has a spare parts shop. He offers both repair services and new spare parts to his customers. Nagina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan to buy different types of spare parts and repair tools for the betterment of his business. He started the business last year, and Nagina is hopeful that it will become established after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nagina.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Myrna is engaged in selling frozen foods in their village to supplement her husband's income. She is 37 years old and has three school-age children. They want to continue sending their children to school because they want them to finish their studies and find a good job someday. Despite the hardships of life, they have the strong determination to improve their status of living. 

Myrna is asking for an additional capital of PHP 9,000 to buy tocino, longaniza (pork sausages), hot dogs and ham to sell. She mentioned that through this loan, she will make an improvement in her business. She hopes that her patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy tocino, longaniza (pork sausages), hot dogs and ham to sell

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 21-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and two siblings. She is a fresh student seeking graduation. Because of her parent’s unsatisfactory revenue, she decided to start her career in 2010 working as a hostess in a local company in order to become the main one responsible for paying her educational fees. But since her income is barely sufficient, she is asking today to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her courses at the university. She is studying Accounting and this is her fourth year. In the future, she plans to take another Kiva loan to pursue her MBA.

loans.use: To pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en: Blanca is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Blanca is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. Despite his young age, Jihad was not afraid to start taking responsibilities on his own. He has worked as a car mechanic since 2009 and was willing to continue his career working in the same occupation. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a minivan for his business. This will allow him to transport needed car spare parts and mechanical machines to serve customers wherever they face car damages. In the future, he plans to further enlarge his garage

loans.use: To purchase a minivan for his business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Analyn has a retail shop that sells used clothing like pants & shirts. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy a stock of used clothing or ukay-ukay.
Analyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing or ukay-ukay

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben has been managing his corn field patiently to earn a living. He has had this kind of business for almost 12 years. He is 39 years old, married and has been blessed with six children.

Ben aims to improve their living situation and to educate his six children but due to shortage of capital he couldn't find ways to start improving his business. With his situation nowadays, he is encouraged to join the program suited for his farming business. Ben is requesting additional loan in the amount of P27,000 to be used in be use in acquiring farm inputs needed in his corn farming business. He believes that through the additional capital and full-time management of the corn field, his yields will increase and he would be able to sell his crops at a higher price which will give him the hope to educate all his children and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to be use in acquiring farm inputs needed in his corn farming business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children; three of them are still attending school, and the others are working to supplement the family’s income. He is an experienced car mechanic. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 15 years. He specializes in balancing wheels. Today, he is looking to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical supplies instead of using the old ones so that he can improve his work and therefore amplify his profits. In the future, he plans to diversify his specialization into car’s repairs.

loans.use: To purchase new mechanical supplies instead of using the old ones so that he can improve his work and therefore amplify his profits

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old married woman with one child, who is not in school. She has had a business of selling at a food stall in Yei county, South Sudan for three years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes, onions, and beans. With her extra income from this loan she hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella is married with three children. Adella is 35 years old and lives in Pereyra Village, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.
Adella has been raising ducks to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan of P35, 000 to purchase feeds for her duck raising.
She is a new member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her duck raising

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Lida has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries & cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.
Lida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, single and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Hatem has owned a woodworking shop since 2009, selling items like bedroom furniture, dining tables and chairs. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation and is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2400 in order to purchase a woodworking machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a woodworking machine.

loans.name: June

texts.en: June is a married man who has three children. June is 51 years old and resides at Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur: Philippines. June operates a home-based business, making and selling buko salad (sweet young coconut salad) products to earn a living. He has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase additional ingredients for buko salad making. June has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, June wants to build a house and to support his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for buko salad making

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and a father for two children.

H. is an owner of a women's accessories shop since 2010, selling clothing and accessories for women, He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing through.

He is requesting a loan of $2400 to build an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To build an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 42 years old and is married with 5 children.

Charlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her store.

Charlene has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items.

Charlene aspires to renovate her store.

loans.use: To buy more products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making souvenirs & wedding decorations

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 40 years old and still single. She lives with her parents and decided to take care of them for they are now old and incapable. She is engaged in a fish-selling business to generate income. She aims to improve the business in order to increase her income to satisfy their needs and save for future emergencies. 

She aims to acquire more stocks of fish to sell but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy bangus and galonggong (fish from Dagupan) to sell in the village. She believes that this loan will help her improve the business as she continues to work and manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy bangus and galonggong (fish from Dagupan) to sell in the village.

loans.name: Ladislas

texts.en:
Ladislas is 50 years old and is married with children. He takes care of one relative who is 18 years old. Ladislas makes a living by selling potatoes. This is his 4th successful year in this business. Ladislas's business is open from 6.30 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day, except Saturday, and he currently employs 2 people to help him.

Ladislas has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more potatoes to sell. With any loan, Ladislas will hopefully earn more profit. This will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability so he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and works hard to support her family.  She sells home products in the Philippines and has been in business for 33 years.

Concepcion requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

In the future, Concepcion would like to expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mukaramhon's Group

texts.en:
Mukaramhon is the treasurer of this group.  She is 54 and married to a retiree whose monthly pension is 4000 soms. 

Mukaramhon works as a nurse in a hospital and earns about 6000 soms per month.  She also owns a piece of land for cultivating agricultural products, like cotton. Last time, she grew about 1400 kg of cotton. 

Selling part of the harvest, Mukaramhon earns an additional 3000 soms per month. 

Her earnings made it possible for her to repair her house and improve her family's living conditions. 

With money received from this loan, she wants to buy fertilizer needed in the sowing process.  In the future she wishes to purchase more land to expand her farming activities. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Rashidan's Group

texts.en:
Rashidan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son who will buy a large number of bedsheets to sell to his customers. 

He has many business contacts and supplies bedsheets to different shops in the market.

She is very confident that her son will make good use of loan and increase his sales and profits.  He has been in business for many years.

Rashidan is a housewife, stays at home and does her household duties.  She is a very responsible person and does her responsibilities very well.

She is the mother of four children.   Three of them remain at home.

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book (Asasah Passbook) is Rashidan”.

loans.use: to sell bedsheets.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 54 years old, married and lives with her husband and her son who are both working.

Samira is an owner of a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing through.

She decided to apply for this loan of $1800 in order to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her store's inventory. She is aiming to gain more profits to allow her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old and married with 5 children.

She works hard to provide for her family.  Celia buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has been in business for eight years.  She also sells charcoal.  She requests a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Celia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF.

Celia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Lolita sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in business for 20 years.  She requests a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

Lolita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 26 years old married woman with two children.  One is in school.  Her husband is a businessman.

She sells ground nut paste in South Sudan and has been in business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase ground nuts.  She hopes to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase ground nuts.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 47 years old and married with 2 children.

Jelly works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Jelly has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF.  She has been in the rice business for 10 years, and also earns an income from a sari-sari (convenience) store.

Jelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dourgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Dourgham has been the owner of his shop since 2006, selling mobiles phone, gifts, stationeries and has a photocopier machine. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 loan in order to purchase a new camera for video and photography. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a new camera for video and photography.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and married with 4 children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Jessica has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF.  She has run a sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income by retailing rice.

Jessica aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 45 years old and married.  He devotes himself full-time to taking care of his corn farm business. 

When the harvest comes, his hard work means that he can sell good quality products to increase his net profits. His monthly income is about PHP 30,000 every season (every five months).  He has 25 years of experience in this field.  

His wife manages their hog-raising business and earns additional income to help meet their daily needs. 

Gregorio is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business. 

He hopes to increase his crop production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business.

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 37 years old and lives in Layawan, Oroquieta City.  She is married with 5 children. 

Esmeralda has a food selling business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month.  She has requested a loan of  5,000 to purchase more food to sell. 

Esmeralda has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 31 years old, married, and has three children between 3 and 12 years old. Alphonsine owns a business selling cooking oil in the market and she is in front of others. She has been in this business for ten years. 

The hours of her work are from 7:00 AM until 8:00 PM every day except Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Alphonsine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cooking oil to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 39 years old, married and mother of eight children.

Sanaa has been an owner of a weaving workshop since 2003. She learned this trade from her mother. She has a good reputation and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. She is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for this loan of $1200 in order to purchase a split air conditioner and a generator for her workshop. She is aiming to get more profits to allow her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner and generator for her workshop.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed and has two children.
 
Edgar has a billiard hall that provides entertainment and a place for leisure. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the billiard hall.

Edgar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the billiard hall.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is a 43-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are sons living with the family and still in school. She is a farmer who grows vegetables and rice. She has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Sorn leads a group of two members and is applying for a first loan with VisionFund. The other member has been with VisionFund for one year. 

Sorn wants to buy seeds for her vegetables plantation and some fertilizers for her rice field. This loan will help her to plant more vegetables and increase her yield which will enable her to earn more income to feed her family, build some savings to buy necessary household items, and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds for vegetables plantation

loans.name: Akkiz's Group

texts.en:
Akkiz is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a constructor who works in Russia. Akkiz takes care of four children: two sons and two daughters. The older son is employed and the other children are students.  Each month the husband transfers Akkiz some money to meet the family needs. Akkiz herself works as a schoolteacher. In order to earn additional money, she breeds livestock. Selling the dairy products, she earns an additional 2,000 soms to meet their needs. With money received from the loan she plans to purchase a sheep for breeding. Some part of the loan she will spend for house repairing. In the future, Akkiz wishes to open a bakery in the center of her village, she explains that there are no bakeries in their village.

Where Did This Loan Come From? 

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep and repair the house.

loans.name: Monaf

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, single and lives with seven family members, two of whom work.

Monaf has been an owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing through.

He decided to apply for this loan of $2400 in order to make display cases and to add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to make display cases and to add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children; one is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.

Selina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. With her extra income from this loan, she hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a married woman with one child. Teresita is 52 years old and is residing at Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Teresita is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for nine years. Each month, she earns 3,260 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to resell. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Teresita wants to expand her business and for her child to finish school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell.

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed . 
Estrella has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy merchandise to sell in her shop.
Estrella is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla enjoys her daily routine at her water refilling business from 8am to 5pm. She established this kind of business three years ago. Her business was located near the university and dormitories, an ideal location for selling purified water to the people in her village. Myla usually makes an average income of P5,000 monthly. Myla reinvests this income in her business, and part of it also pays for electric bills and meals for the family. 

Myla is now 30 years old and has an infant child. She is asking for a loan of P30,000 for additional capital to buy plastic gallon containers for her water refilling service. She will also use the loan to pay for a business license to allow her to continue to operate. She wants to be able to meet her customers' demands for clean and safe water to drink. 

In the future, Myla would like to earn a consistent income and save for the education of her child. She wants to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to pay for a business license and buy plastic gallon containers for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en:
Tuyatsetseg is 22 years old and lives with her husband and mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her hairdressing business, which she started in 2008. Her salon is known for providing excellent service at an affordable price. However, her equipment is in unusable condition. 

Tuyatsetseg is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I never thought that I could go this far. Now that I have, I will work as hard as possible." She is requesting 1,500,000 to buy new equipment for her hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Ochirhand

texts.en:
Ochirhand is 51 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband also sells meat, and her daughter lives separately. 

Orchirhand started her business in 1995 by selling meat at the local market. She has 16 years of business and work experience in her field. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "In the future with my profits i am planning to purchase a car for business purposes." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Saima Rani's Group

texts.en:
Saima Rani is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Saima's husband is a contractor and builds houses and other buildings. He is very experienced in his work. All of Saima's children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education, except the eldest one, who is 22 years old. He left school after completing the eighth grade. He now runs a video game shop.

Saima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s video game shop. With the loan, he will purchase different video games that will allow him to earn more income by encouraging more children from his community to play video games. He has been operating his business for many years, and Saima is very hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and will increase his income.

Saima is a new loan user with Asasah, and this is her first loan application. She is hopeful that this loan will help her son's business succeed. In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Saima Rani.

loans.use: to buy video games.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly believes that, "Poverty is not a hindrance to success". She is 46 and has three school-age children. She is married to a farmer and they live harmoniously in a village. They live through farming. They plant rice and vegetables to sell. Since their children are now in a higher level of education, they are in need of financial support. 

In this regard, Nelly is engaged in selling detergent soaps and dishwashing soaps to earn additional income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional stock of detergent soaps and dishwashing soaps to sell in their village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will make an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent and dishwashing soaps to sell

loans.name: Sheryl Grace

texts.en:
Sheryl Grace is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Sheryl Grace has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Sheryl Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sheryl Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en: Khom is 40 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children are workers and the other two are still in school. For the last 20 years, she has made a living from her rice field. She also raise cows for others to gain additional income. Khom is a leader of a group of two female members. This is a first loan with VisionFund for her group. She is requesting a loan to pay for others who cut grass for the cows that she raises. With this loan, she hopes to increase her grass stock to feed the cow to be healthy and fat and earn more income from her labor to feed her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for others to cut grass for her stock

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a 30-year-old married woman who has five children. Four of them are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan.
Lona requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maksatgul's Group

texts.en:
Maksatgul is the leader of this group. She is 29 and married to a builder, whose monthly salary is 5000 soms. Together with her husband, she is raising three daughters. The older daughter studies at school, and the other daughters are preschool age. 

In order to earn money, Maksatgul breeds cattle and sells dairy products. She also cultivates agricultural products and sells some each month. In this way, she earns about 5000 soms per month. Maksatgul has saved some money, but she needs more to purchase a cow. This is why she is applying for a loan. In the future, she wants to increase the number of cattle she owns.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is the father of five school-aged children. His wife is engaged in the hog-raising business, but the source of income for his great family is the business of growing corn. He has been in this business for twenty-five-years. He earned about 40,000 PHP with his last crop. 

Now, Orlando wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn farm. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can fulfill the financial needs of his family and save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn farm.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en: Odonchimeg is 44 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband is a clerk at the local hospital. Her son is a college student and her daughter is a high school student. She started her business in 2004 by selling meat at the local market. She has many years of work and business experience. She has many regular clients and became well known in her local town. She is planning to expand her business by buying a container. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "Having a container is very important for my business because I can do my business very well without any problem." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is a married man with three children. Leonardo is 56 years old and resides at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Leonardo is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to the local community members to earn a living. He's been doing this business for 30 years. Each month he earns PHP 13,550 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Leonardo has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Leonardo wants to build a house and to finish the studies of his children.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker and three of her kids live independently. The other two are college students. She has been working as a sewer since 1981. She has been sewing at home since 1990. She is well known around the neighborhood. Her sewing machine is getting old. Therefore, she needs a new one to run a business. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "Now that my kids old enough, I need to concentrate to my business". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has been in business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for five years.
Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan is a married woman and the mother of a single child. She lives with her husband and her lovely child in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap. Chan is a farmer, and she is also a staff member of an organization that provides poor families with jobs and helps increase their incomes. She is able to earn an average of $5.00 per day through her work.

This is Chan's first loan request with Kiva. She wants to use the funds to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides to keep her potato crop growing well. She intends to use the increased profit she’ll earn to enroll her child in a local school and to save some money to expand her farmland in the next few years.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides for her potato crop.

loans.name: Ulziihishig

texts.en:
Ulziihishig is 45 years old and lives with her family in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband drives a truck for a mining company, her daughter works for a cosmetics company, and her son is a high school student. 

Ulziihishig started her business in 1996 by selling meat at the local market. She has since moved her business to a new market. She has many years of work and business experience in her field. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who says, "The price of meat is going up, and I need to have more meat." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and increase her turnover capital. She purchased new land and thus lacked turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Samit's Group

texts.en: Samit is a 42-year-old father of seven children. Four of the children are married, two children work for others and one child is still in school. He has been growing soybeans to make a living for 18 years. He also raises cows and works for others to generate additional income. Samit was with Vision Fund two years ago and he completeL. paid his loans to Vision Fund. He is applying for his third loan to grow soybeans on his farmland. This loan will help him to make more soybeans to generate more income in order for him to feed his famiL., build some savings to buy necessary household stuff and also keep his child in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his soybean plantation

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en: Odonchimeg is 30 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband has a private business. Her children are high school students and kindergarten attendants. She was a waitress at the local business center in 2006. In 2008, she started selling food and products at the local market. She rents a commercial space at the market and sells both food and hygiene products at the retail price. She is planning to improve her business in the future. She is a diligent and hard working woman who says, "I want to provide a good education to my children and expand my business successfully." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Huvsguldalai

texts.en: Huvsguldalai is 24 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband works at construction sites during the summer. Her two sons attend kindergarten. She started selling clothes in June 2011 at the local market. She buys all her clothes and goods from China. She is planning to improve her business and diversify her products range. She is a hardworking and energetic woman who says, "This business is very competitive and I am a newcomer to this. I am doing my best to set my business apart from the competitors." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy winter clothes to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Jane has a food shop or canteen that sells snacks such as rice cakes and halo-halo (flavored, crushed ice). She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, milk, coffee, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fedeliza

texts.en:
Fedeliza  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Fedeliza has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and rice.

Fedeliza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice

loans.name: Pring's Group

texts.en: Pring, 43 years old, is married with three children. All her children are still in school. For the last two years, she has been raising pigs to support her family. She also grows rice to better feed her family. She leads a group of two female members. Her group has been with VisionFund for three years. She completely paid her loans to VisionFund. Now she is requesting a fourth loan. She wants to buy feeds for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to feed her pigs to be healthy and fat. She also hopes to earn more income so that she can buy the basic necessities for the family and keep her three children in school.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo lives with his family in the village of Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 50 years old and a father of three children. Two of the children are currently in school. Eduardo is a farmer who grows corn. He has 35 years of experience in this field and, through his harvests, he manages to provide food for their family needs. 

At this time, Eduardo is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm business

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin, 38, is a rice cultivator from Kompong Chhnang province. She has spent most of her life doing this business. Ngin has a life partner in her husband who works as a joiner in mobile places. This couple is blessed with three children. Two of her children are garment factory workers in the province, while the other one is a student living under her support. 

Ngin always expects to lift her family from poverty by using all of her efforts; however, she is able to generate $1.50 each day. But now she is asking for a loan from Kiva’s funders to purchase rice to sell in the future. With the remaining fund, she’ll buy some piglets to raise in a wooden piggery behind her own house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell and piglets to raise

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 34. She supports her husband by doing embroidery works. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month.

Her husband has a livestock business. He purchases goats and sheep in their young age, grows them up and sells to butchers and on Eid for profits.

Zubaida is the mother of a son; she is a good housewife and a very caring mother.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business; with the loan, he will buy goats and sheep in larger numbers and then sell them for profits after growing them up.

Her husband is an experienced person and has been in his business for many years. Zubaida is hopeful that after the loan investment, he will successfully be able to upgrade his business and increase his profits.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for an animal sales business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child.

Marife has a retail shop that sells clothing, footwear, and umbrellas. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more clothing, footwear, and umbrellas.

Marife is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory including clothing, footwear, and umbrellas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Maria has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Maria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Michel has a pigpen and sells mature, grown pigs. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Michel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 33-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She has been running a pub in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.
Grace requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase sugar and fish for sale. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish, beer and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Elvia has a food shop that sells snacks like banana & sweet potato cue. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks .
Elvia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Prexidice

texts.en:
Prexidice is a hardworking business woman aged 24. She is single and blessed with one child who is in school. She has been running a grocery business for the last three years to support her family. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. Her potential customers are passers-by and local residents. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving. 

Prexidice has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a married man aged 25. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been operating a motorbike transport business for the past three years to support his family. He also does farming to supplement his income. Antony has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy motorbike spare parts. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Janice has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock from AVON.
Janice is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON such as clothing & beauty products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lorna has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock for her store.
Lorna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single woman aged 35 and is blessed with one child who is in school. She has been running a pub for the past two years to bring up her family. She has employed one person to assist her in running the business. Sarah has requested a loan of 24,000 Kenya shillings to buy a refrigerator for beer storage. In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Vanic

texts.en: Vanic is a single man aged 21. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. For the past three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He also sell cereals to earn more income. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a van. Vanic has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize and beans for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas is a 21-year-old young man. He is a worker with a decent salary. He is a university student majoring in Business Administration and wants to complete paying his fees, but he does not have enough money. Therefore, he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Anas gets the loan, he will be able to pay his university fees and complete his course to graduate and get a university degree in Business. This will improve his standard of living and enable him to get better work in the future. Anas is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is 28 years old, married and has 1 kid. She has been running a grocery store for more than 2 years. She sells items such as cake, vegetable oil, detergent and beer. She is requesting her first loan with VisionFund to buy stock of groceries for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her stock and increase the family income. She hopes to set aside some money for future needs and also for her kid.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock for her store

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a focused business-woman aged 29. She is a single mother of a three-year-old child. For the past three years, she has been running a beauty salon. The major challenge she faces is competition but she is able to retain her customers because of her good services. Mary has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and hair chemicals. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy braids and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Both of them are in school. She has had a charcoal selling business in Yei, South Sudan for three years.
Jackline requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. With the extra income from this loan, she hopes to pay for her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income for her family.
She lives in her brother’s home with her 6 children. Five of them are studying while her youngest daughter stays at home and helps Rasoolan in her household responsibilities.
